setup.plugins.name: Plug-in settings...
setup.plugins.text:
Here you can administrate all modules found in the shop.
As a rule, each module can also be deactivated.
In addition, you can adjust various settings in each module.

setup.plugins.adbutler.name: AdButler:
setup.plugins.adbutler.text:
Module to evaluate shop sales generated through affiliate partners.

You can learn more about affiliate partners/programs [HERE]

Please contact AdButler (http://www.adbutler.de) to receive a "PID", which is an identification number you have to enter in order for the interface to function properly.

setup.plugins.adbutler.xpl_adbutler.adbu.kurztext: Please contact AdButler (http://www.adbutler.de) to receive a "PID". A PID is an identification number you have to enter in order for the interface to function properly.
setup.plugins.adbutler.xpl_adbutler.adbu.name: Activate AdButler
setup.plugins.adbutler.xpl_adbutler.adbu.text:
Adbutler organizes placement and payment between advertisers and portals offering advertising spots.

You can place advertising banners, product links and other digital promotions there.

setup.plugins.adbutler.xpl_adbutler.adbu.kurztext: If necessary, you can get the the PID using a URL. You can determine the PID from the URL (the number following "pid=").
setup.plugins.adbutler.xpl_adbutler.adbu.name: PID from AdButler
setup.plugins.adbutler.xpl_adbutler.adbu.text:
If necessary, you can get the the PID using a URL.
You can determine the PID from the URL (the number following "pid=").
Otherwise, please ask your contact person at AdButler.

setup.plugins.afterbuy.xpl_afterbuy.afte.kurztext: Don't send out confirmation emails through the shop.
setup.plugins.afterbuy.xpl_afterbuy.afte.name: shop internal order confirmation email
setup.plugins.afterbuy.xpl_afterbuy.afte.text: You can deactivate the shop internal order confirmation email here if you want to take care of order communication using Afterbuy.

setup.plugins.afterbuy.xpl_afterbuy.afte.name: Set feedback time point
setup.plugins.afterbuy.xpl_afterbuy.afte.text:
Here you can determine whether a time should be set for feedback regarding the order process. This is important for the Afterbuy system and the workflow integrated into it.
You can also set whether a mail should be sent from the shop system.
Normally, Afterbuy sends all status emails, taking care of all communications with customers.

setup.plugins.afterbuy.xpl_afterbuy.afte.kurztext: When set, Afterbuy will make no attempt to determine delivery charges. (Don't determine weight, shipping group and cross-catalog)
setup.plugins.afterbuy.xpl_afterbuy.afte.name: Don't calculate delivery charges at Afterbuy
setup.plugins.afterbuy.xpl_afterbuy.afte.text: When set, Afterbuy will make no attempt to determine delivery charges. (Don't determine weight, shipping group and cross-catalog)

setup.plugins.afterbuy.xpl_afterbuy.afte.name: Activation of order export interface
setup.plugins.afterbuy.xpl_afterbuy.afte.text:
Here you can activate order export to the Afterbuy system.
This transfers every order to Afterbuy directly after it is sent off.
You can also determine whether the shop should send a confirmation email, or if Afterbuy should take on all further functions.
All following functions are explained below in corresponding sections.

setup.plugins.afterbuy.xpl_afterbuy.afte.kurztext: Afterbuy will send you your Afterbuy Partner ID.
setup.plugins.afterbuy.xpl_afterbuy.afte.name: Afterbuy Partner ID
setup.plugins.afterbuy.xpl_afterbuy.afte.text: Enter your Afterbuy Partner ID. You will get this ID directly from Afterbuy.

setup.plugins.afterbuy.xpl_afterbuy.afte.kurztext: Afterbuy will send you your Afterbuy Partner password.
setup.plugins.afterbuy.xpl_afterbuy.afte.name: Afterbuy Partner password
setup.plugins.afterbuy.xpl_afterbuy.afte.text: Afterbuy will send you your Afterbuy Partner password.

setup.plugins.afterbuy.xpl_afterbuy.afte.kurztext: When set, shop article numbers will be placed directly after the Afterbuy article numbers. For this to work, shop article numbers must be purely numeric.
setup.plugins.afterbuy.xpl_afterbuy.afte.name: Use shop article number
setup.plugins.afterbuy.xpl_afterbuy.afte.text:
When set, shop article numbers will be placed directly after the Afterbuy article numbers.
For this to work, shop article numbers must be purely numeric.

setup.plugins.afterbuy.xpl_afterbuy.afte.kurztext: Afterbuy will supply you with this ID.
setup.plugins.afterbuy.xpl_afterbuy.afte.name: Afterbuy User ID
setup.plugins.afterbuy.xpl_afterbuy.afte.text: Afterbuy will supply you with this ID.

setup.plugins.aktivierung.kurztext:
Here you can deactivate unused plug-ins in order to improve shop performance.
The plug-ins can be activated here again at any time.
Plug-ins that have not been unlocked will appear in cursive and cannot be activated.
setup.plugins.aktivierung.name: General shop plug-ins activation
setup.plugins.aktivierung.text:
Many shop features are organized as so-called "plug-ins". These features often have special configuration settings.

In the "General activation" form you can completely turn off plug-ins that you don't need. These menus and entry fields will then no longer appear in the admin interface which simplifies the overview.

The plug-in will no longer be loaded in the front-end / shop. This way you save program and server resources.

setup.plugins.amazon.xpl_amazon.amazon_v.name: Standard shipping times for Amazon
setup.plugins.amazon.xpl_amazon.amazon_v.text:
Amazon requires entry of shipping times, so that the product data feed can start.
Here you can enter your shipping time in days.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Amazon Pay Button: Color
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: You can choose the color of the Amazon "Pay" button here.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Acceptance Test Password
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: You can fill in any password here to be told to your Amazon Consultant. If a password is provided, and you append the string &amazontest= followed by this password at the URL of checkout page step 1, the Amazon Pay Button will be displayed even if otherwise not displayed by deactivation the display option above. Using this, you can perform acceptance tests for the plugin integration without having to activate the button to the public.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Amazon Pay Button: Size
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: You can choose the size of the Amazon "Pay" button here.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Pay Button Infotext
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: This text is shown at the "Amazon Pay" button when hovering the button with the mouse. The predefined text here is given by Amazon and can be changed or even deleted to omit the tooltip.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Currency
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: ISO Currency Code für the value transmission to Amazon. Kindly note, that Amazon only allows a restricted list of currencies, currently "EUR" for Euros and "GBP" for British Pounds. The currency code here has to match the currency in the shop.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..anzeigetitel: Default customer group for dynamic account creation
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Default customer group for dynamic account creation
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: When a customer logs in with the Amazon Login button and didn't have a customer account before, but there are already orders using the email address of the amazon account, a shop customer account will be dynamically created based on the invoice address of the last order found. Here you can define which customer group this newly created account shall initially be assigned to.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Error: Payment rejected
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: This error is shown, when Amazon rejects the payment transaction as whole, not only because of a rejected payment method. In this case, the customer will be thrown to step 1 of the checkout to select an regular checkout without Amazon there.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Error: Service not available
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: This error is shown, if the Amazon Pay service is currently not available due to technical problems. This is no payment rejection, but a 'please try again in a few minutes' case.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Error: Timeout
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: This error is shown, if Amazon Payments can't approve the payment request within 8 seconds and you have set up here, that the customer then shall be given an error message to chose another payment methos.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Error: Amazon Login not possible
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: As a customer performs a login with the Amazon Login Button, the shop is given an authorization token, that allows is to fetch the name and email address of the customer. This error is shown, if this data can't be fetched, and therefore should only be displayed if there are technical problems on the Amazon side or the token has been manipulated.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Error: No address selected
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: This error is shown, if no address has been selected within the Amazon address widget.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Error: No payment method selected
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: This error is shown, if no payment method has been selected within the Amazon wallet widget.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Error: Packstation not allowed
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: This error is shown when selecting an adress containing "Packstation" while excluding Packstations by the setup option here.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Error: Payment method rejected
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: This error is shown, if Amazon afterwards rejects a previously offered payment method, e.g. due to bad credit standing. In this case, the customer will be thown to step 4 of the checkout, redisplaying the Amazon wallet widget, to select an alternative payment method there.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Error: Shipping country not supported
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: This error is shown, if the customer selects an address out of his Amazon address book, which is not provided by the shop.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Error: odd email addresses
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: This error is shown, when there is a shop account matching the email address of the amazon account, the customer is prompted to log in with his shop account, but he logs in with an other shop account having an email address not machting the amazon email address.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..anzeigetitel: Invoicing tray for orders with unsafe payment state
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Invoicing tray for orders with unsafe payment state
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: If orders with unsafe payment state are accepted, they can be hold in a separate tray named here, until the payment authorization has been approved. Orders here should be moved to the entry tray automatically on incoming positive authentification notification, but you should check this tray manually from time to time in case of hanging orders.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Live mode
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: If this option is active, there will be real financial transactions. If not, you are in a sandbox mode, where transactions are one simulated, to perform function tests of the payment interface.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Amazon Login Button: Color
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: You can choose the color of the Amazon "Login" button here.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Amazon Login Button: Size
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: You can choose the size of the Amazon "Login" button here.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Login Client ID
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text:
Please follow the link in the head area of this setup form. After logging in there with your SellerCentral account data, you can read the neccessary value directly there.

Please fill in this value solely by using Copy & Paste and don't type it by hand. In addition please make sure, you don't accidently fill in additional white space characters.

Kindly note, that you have to create a login application prior of accessing this ID. To do this, please change the top dropdown to the area "Login with Amazon" and create an application there. Afterwards you can read the "Client ID" here. The "Client Secret" is not needed for the shop.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Offer address repair
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: In case the customer logs in with Amazon Login, didn't have a customer account yet but already had orders using his email address, a new customer account is dynamically created using the address of the previous order. In this option, you can determine what the customer will see after this automatical account creation. If active, the customer will be shown the "Edit Customerdata" page, where he can check his address data and eventually register for the newsletter. If this option is not active, the customer will be shown the regular "My Account" page, just like regulary logging into the shop.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Message: login required
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: This message is shown when there is a not yet linked shop account with the same email address as the amazon account.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Message: login not yet possible
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: This message is shown, when there is neither a shop account nor previous orders for the email address of the amazon account. As Amazon only provides name and email at this place, creating a complete customer account isn't possible yet. Therefore the customer is told to simply log in again after he committed his first order.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Message: account successfully linked
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: This message is shown after a customer had been demanded to log in with his shop account of the same email address. If successful, the shop account is linked once with the amazon account and this message is shown.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: MWS Access Key ID
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text:
Please follow the link in the head area of this setup form. After logging in there with your SellerCentral account data, you can read the neccessary value directly there.

Please fill in this value solely by using Copy & Paste and don't type it by hand. In addition please make sure, you don't accidently fill in additional white space characters.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: MWS Secret Access Key
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text:
Please follow the link in the head area of this setup form. After logging in there with your SellerCentral account data, you can read the neccessary value directly there.

Please fill in this value solely by using Copy & Paste and don't type it by hand. In addition please make sure, you don't accidently fill in additional white space characters.

Please note that your login password is not meant here. This refers to an encrypted string that is usually 40 characters long.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..anzeigetitel: Only Amazon Checkout available after Amazon-Login
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Only Amazon Checkout available after Amazon-Login
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: Use this option to hide the regular checkout button as well as the PayPal Express button if appropriate when the user has logged in with the "Login with Amazon" button before.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Behaviour for authorization timeouts
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text:
Amazon Pay provides fraud protection mechanisms that cause random payment requests, mainly with higher amount, to be verified manually. This verification takes usually only minutes but can be up to 24 hours. As the Amazon Payment interface gives a transaction feedback after a maximum of 8 seconds, the feedback is a "timeout".

In this case, you have 2 choices:

a) the customer is told to select an other payment method out of the shop's regular payment methods. In this case all incoming Amazon Payments orders can be immediately processed without keeping the payment status in sight

b) the order will be accepted despite of the insecure payment status and is set to a special order status, that can be provided here, as well as a note in the order confirmation email. In case of using the CosmoShop's Invoicing, the order is put there in a special tray as well.

When receiving the automatic authorization notification, the order is automatically reset to its original state as well as tray. In this case the customer will also receive the regular "order status has changed" email.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..anzeigetitel: Order status for orders with unsafe payment state
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Order status for orders with unsafe payment state
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text:
If orders with unsafe payment state are accepted, they can get a separate order status named here. We recommend activating automatic notification emails for this order status, as the customer willl then be informed about the unsafe payment state additionally to the remark in the order confirmation email.

On incoming positive authentification notification, the order status will automatically change back to the state it would have when not having been unsafe. Additionally an order state change email will be sent, even if automatic order state change emails are not active for this order state.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Packstation not allowed
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: Use this option to prevent orders having the keyword "Packstation" within the address fields. Used if you are not able to deliver to Packstations.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Seller ID
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text:
Please follow the link in the head area of this setup form. After logging in there with your SellerCentral account data, you can read the neccessary value directly there.

Please fill in this value solely by using Copy & Paste and don't type it by hand. In addition please make sure, you don't accidently fill in additional white space characters.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..kurztext: The placeholder [[auftragsnr]] will be replaced by the order number of the shop.
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Free text: Payment Authorization
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text:
This free text will be used in emails from amazon to the customer. Maximum of 1024 characters allowed, no HTML.

Please get informed by your Amazon Customer Support, if and how this string is used in the productive ssytem. In the sandbox system, it is used by Amazon to simulate error scenarios.

The placeholder [[auftragsnr]] will be replaced by the order number of the shop.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..kurztext: The placeholder [[auftragsnr]] will be replaced by the order number of the shop.
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Free text: Order
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text:
This free text will be used in emails from amazon to the customer. Maximum of 1024 characters allowed, no HTML.

Please get informed by your Amazon Customer Support, if and how this string is used in the productive ssytem. In the sandbox system, it is used by Amazon to simulate error scenarios.

The placeholder [[auftragsnr]] will be replaced by the order number of the shop.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Amazon Login Button in 'My Account'
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text:
If you activate this option, the login button will displayed on the "My Account" Page beneath the classic shop login. When clicked, and an account with matching email address is found, it will be linked to the amazon account. From then on a login with the amazon login button is similar to a login with the shop account. If there is not yet an account with this email address, matching orders in the shop are searched and linked if found, dynamically creating a shop account.

If the "Amazon Pay" button is clicked within an hour after logging in with the amazon login button, no further login is necessary when clicking the 'Pay' button in the checkout.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Activate Error Simulation
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text:
When the shop is not in live mode, you can make the checkout show simulation checkboxes here. This is relevant especially in order step 3 for address checking and in order step 5 for payment validation. When these simulation checkboxes are clicked, the respective error case is forced and the shop shows the error texts as defined below in this setup page. This error handling testing is relevant during interface acceptance tests by amazon.

These simulation checkboxes are never displayed in live mode.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Simulation Label 4
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: will be shown in checkout step 5, as long as the live mode is not activ and the option "Activate Error Simulation" has been selected.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Simulation Label 1
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: will be shown in checkout step 3, as long as the live mode is not activ and the option "Activate Error Simulation" has been selected.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Simulation Label 3
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: will be shown in checkout step 5, as long as the live mode is not activ and the option "Activate Error Simulation" has been selected.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Simulation Label 2
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: will be shown in checkout step 4, as long as the live mode is not activ and the option "Activate Error Simulation" has been selected.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..anzeigetitel: Order state after successul amount reservation
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Order state after successul amount reservation
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: After a successfull reservation of the order value, Amazon gives for the next 7 days a successful-capture-guarantee, respectively an immediate delivery release. Here you have the possibility to define a specific order state these orders shall be assigned to at the moment of the successful reservation. Therefore you may add an own order state like "Amazon ready for delivery" and assign it here.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Capture/Refund mode
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text: You can specify here, if the orders/refundes shall be performed automatically when changing to a specific order state, or if the capture/refund will only happen when manually clicking a checkbox, offered in the order status administration as you change the order to the appropriate order state

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Order state for automatical capture
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text:
If you chose an order status here, you can make the shop perform the capture of the order value automatically. Depending on the "Capture/Refund mode" you can capture automatically when changing to this order state or manually via checkbox when changing the order state in the order status administration.

If you didn't specify an order status here, there will never be an automatic capture, and you have to perform this always manually in the Amazon Order List or directly in the SellerCentral area at Amazon.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Order state for automatical refund
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text:
if you chose an order status here, you can make the shop perform the refund of the order value automatically. Depending on the "Capture/Refund mode" you can refund automatically when changing to this order state or manually via checkbox when changing the order state in the order status administration.

If you didn't specify an order status here, there will never be an automatic refund, and you have to perform this always manually in the Amazon Order List or directly in the SellerCentral area at Amazon. Kindly note that refunding will only happen when a successful capture of the same order value has happened before

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..anzeigetitel: Amazon Pay button in checkout step 1
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Amazon Pay button in checkout step 1
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text:
If you activate this option, the Amazon Pay button will be displayed in step 1 of the checkout.

Kindly remark, that you can activate this button or the one in checkout step 2 or both.

setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..name: Amazon button in checkout step 2
setup.plugins.amazon_LPA.xpl_amazon_LPA..text:
If you activate this option, the Amazon Pay button will be displayed in step 2 of the checkout.

Kindly remark, that you can activate this button or the one in checkout step 1 or both.

setup.plugins.amazon_advanced_payments.x.name: Amazon button in checkout step 2
setup.plugins.amazon_advanced_payments.x.text:
If you activate this option, the Amazon Payments button will be displayed in step 2 of the checkout.

Kindly remark, that you can activate this button or the one in checkout step 1 or both.

setup.plugins.amazon_advanced_payments.x.name: Error: Payment rejected
setup.plugins.amazon_advanced_payments.x.text: This error is shown, when Amazon rejects the payment transaction as whole, not only because of a rejected payment method. In this case, the customer will be thrown to step 1 of the checkout to select an regular checkout without Amazon there.

setup.plugins.amazon_advanced_payments.x.name: Error: Service not available
setup.plugins.amazon_advanced_payments.x.text: This error is shown, if the Amazon Payments service is currently not available due to technical problems. This is no payment rejection, but a 'please try again in a few minutes' case.

setup.plugins.amazon_advanced_payments.x.name: Error: No address selected
setup.plugins.amazon_advanced_payments.x.text: This error is shown, if no address has been selected within the Amazon address widget.

setup.plugins.amazon_advanced_payments.x.name: Error: No payment method selected
setup.plugins.amazon_advanced_payments.x.text: This error is shown, if no payment method has been selected within the Amazon wallet widget.

setup.plugins.amazon_advanced_payments.x.name: Error: Payment method rejected
setup.plugins.amazon_advanced_payments.x.text: This error is shown, if Amazon afterwards rejects a previously offered payment method, e.g. due to bad credit standing. In this case, the customer will be thown to step 4 of the checkout, redisplaying the Amazon wallet widget, to select an alternative payment method there.

setup.plugins.amazon_advanced_payments.x.name: Error: Shipping country not supported
setup.plugins.amazon_advanced_payments.x.text: This error is shown, if the customer selects an address out of his Amazon address book, which is not provided by the shop.

setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.name: Amazon button in order step 1
setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.text:
If you activate this option, a "Pay through Amazon" button will appear in order step 1 next to the normal "Next" button.

Please note that either this option or the option for order step 2 must be activated, so that the customer can "Pay through Amazon". Both options can also be active.

setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.name: Amazon button in order step 2
setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.text:
If you activate this option, in order step 2, in addition to the question whether the customer has an account or would like to create one, there will be an option to order through an Amazon account. If this option is selected, the "Order through Amazon" button will appear instead of the "Next" button.

Please note that either this option or the option for order step 1 must be active so that the customer can "Pay through Amazon". Both options can be active.

setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.name: Invoice deposit for new orders without release
setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.text:
All Amazon orders which have been sent out but have received no payment release are saved in this invoice depository (a release is normally issued within 20 minutes after sending the order). Orders in this depository cannot be invoiced, and therefore the corresponding buttons for processing them are inactive.

Note: This depository must have the "Amazon" string in its name in order to be recognized

setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.name: Invoice deposit for cancellations
setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.text:
All Amazon orders that have been reported by Amazon as "canceled" are found in this invoice depository. Please note that the customer can cancel the order 20 minutes after sending it off. After the shipping release from Amazon has been received, the customer cannot cancel the order directly, but you can do so in your Amazon Payment merchant back-end. In either case, the order will automatically land in this depository. Orders here cannot be invoiced, which is why the corresponding buttons are missing.

Note: This depository must have the "Amazon" string in its name in order to be recognized

setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.name: Error: No address selected
setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.text: This error message appears when no address has been selected in the Amazon widget.

setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.name: Error: No payment method selected
setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.text: This error message appears when no payment method has been selected in the Amazon widget.

setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.name: Error: Destination country not supported
setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.text: This error message appears when the delivery address selected in the Amazon widget is in a country that is not supported by the shop, or for which the Amazon Payment payment method has not been activated.

setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.name: Live operation
setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.text:
If this option is active, a payment release will come from Amazon usually 20 minutes after the order has been sent off. The article can be shipped only after this release reaches the shop.

If this option isn't activated, the order will be sent to the Amazon test server and no payment release messages will be sent to the shop.

setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.name: Merchant ID
setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.text: This value will be provided by Amazon or you can retrieve it from your Amazon Payment back-end.

setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.name: AWS access key ID
setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.text: This value will be provided by Amazon or you can retrieve it from your Amazon Payment back-end.

setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.name: AWS secret code
setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.text:
This value will be provided by Amazon or you can retrieve it from your Amazon Payment back-end.

Please note that your login password is not meant here. This refers to an encrypted string that is usually 40 characters long.

setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.name: Processing status for new orders without release
setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.text: All new Amazon orders automatically receive this processing status. Please note that as long as the order has this status, it can be canceled by the customer. Approximately 20 minutes after the order has been sent off, Amazon will send a notification that releases it from this status.

setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.name: Processing status in case of cancellation
setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.text:
All orders that are identified by Amazon as "canceled" automatically receive this processing status. Please note that the customer can cancel the order within 20 minutes of sending it off. After you have received the shipping release from Amazon, the customer can no longer cancel the order directly, but you can cancel it in your Amazon Payment merchant back-end. In both cases, the order will be automatically set to this status.

Orders with this status cannot change status.

setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.name: Processing status at the time of release
setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.text:
All Amazon orders receive this processing status after approximately 20 minutes if the customer hasn't cancelled them.

As soon as this processing status has been reached, the order can be shipped at any time. After shipping, the goods must be set to "Processing status after shipment" in order to activate booking payment from the customer's account.

Orders which are not shipped for a certain number of days are automatically canceled by Amazon. You can learn more about this topic from your Amazon merchant representative.

setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.name: Processing status after article shipment
setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.text:
If this status is set for orders, an "Order shipped" notification will be sent to Amazon and Amazon will charge the customer's account.

Orders with this status can only be changed to "Canceled" status.

Please note that if an order with this status is canceled, no automatic booking of the amount to the customer will take place. You can do this in your Amazon Payment merchant area.

setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.kurztext: Please set a payment type with the "Amazon Payments" description and indicate the payment method for all compatible payment types and all allowed shipping countries (optimally for all countries that you can deliver to). The payment type indicated here will be indicated in the order email. This payment type can only be selected for "Pay through Amazon" and will be automatically hidden for regular orders. Warning: if no payment type is indicated here, the Amazon payment method will not be available.
setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.name: Amazon Payments shop configuration
setup.plugins.amazon_payment.xpl_amazon_.text:
Please set a payment type with the "Amazon Payments" description and indicate the payment method for all compatible payment types and all allowed shipping countries (optimally for all countries that you can deliver to). The payment type indicated here will be indicated in the order email. This payment type can only be selected for "Pay through Amazon" and will be automatically hidden for regular orders.
Warning: if no payment type is indicated here, the Amazon payment method will not be available

setup.plugins.anfragen.name: Request modules
setup.plugins.anfragen.text:
In order to activate one or multiple modules for your shop, please select the corresponding plug-in boxes. If you would like to add something to your request, you can use the additional text entry field.

When this form is sent, we will automatically be informed about your request with checked boxes and the additional text. We will quickly put together an offer for commissioning the module for you.

setup.plugins.angebot_statt_kauf.name: Offer instead of purchase:
setup.plugins.angebot_statt_kauf.text:
enables your customers to either buy an article or request it.
For this, an additional "Request item" button appears in the article detail view. If a visitor clicks on this button, the article will come up on a separate request list (below the mini shopping cart at the top right in the shop).
In the shopping cart/checkout area the requested and purchased items will appear mixed. This way a visitor can either request and/or buy articles in one go.
Requested items will be displayed without price.

Activate the module on this page and define the start value of the request number.
This works similarly to the order confirmation number, counting one higher for each request.

setup.plugins.angebot_statt_kauf.xpl_ang.kurztext: Initialization of request counter (similar to the order counter)
setup.plugins.angebot_statt_kauf.xpl_ang.name: Request counters
setup.plugins.angebot_statt_kauf.xpl_ang.text:
Set the start number of the continuing request counter.
Using continuous numbers (7 figures, or x figures, as you like) makes sure you don't lose any requests).

setup.plugins.artikel_videos.xpl_artikel.kurztext: is used when no article-specific width is indicated
setup.plugins.artikel_videos.xpl_artikel.name: Width

setup.plugins.artikel_videos.xpl_artikel.kurztext: is used when no article-specific width is indicated
setup.plugins.artikel_videos.xpl_artikel.name: Height

setup.plugins.artikelvergleichen.name: Article comparison function:
setup.plugins.artikelvergleichen.text:
In the article listing of each article, the shop visitor will see a checkbox to mark the article to be compared.
Above the listing is a button "Compare selected articles".
After clicking, a pop-up window will open displaying selected items next to each other.
This includes the article name, image, description and price.

Here you can define:
1. should the feature be available in the shop
2. should there be a deep link to the article detail view in the pop-up? (simplified operation)
3. should the price appear in the pop-up?
4. should the article image appear in the pop-up?
5. should the content of the optional additional page appear (not recommended because it is usually too much for the format)
6. should the article description appear in the pop-up?

setup.plugins.artikelvergleichen.xpl_art.name: Article comparison function
setup.plugins.artikelvergleichen.xpl_art.text:
Activation of this interface enables the shop visitor to compare various articles to each other. The shop expands by a "Compare articles" link on the article detail page and in the article listing. As soon as this link is clicked, a list of articles to be compared will appear in the top left (depends on the template).
Using the compare button found there, the visitor comes to an overview that places the articles next to each other.

setup.plugins.artikelvergleichen.xpl_art.kurztext: Should article description appear in the pop-up?
setup.plugins.artikelvergleichen.xpl_art.name: Show the article description text in the comparison view
setup.plugins.artikelvergleichen.xpl_art.text: The article description activation in the comparison overview is recommended, as long as the contents aren't very long.

setup.plugins.artikelvergleichen.xpl_art.kurztext: Should the article image appear in the pop-up?
setup.plugins.artikelvergleichen.xpl_art.name: Show article image in the comparison view
setup.plugins.artikelvergleichen.xpl_art.text: It is recommended to activate the image display in the comparison overview.

setup.plugins.artikelvergleichen.xpl_art.kurztext: Should the contents of the additional page be displayed in the pop-up?
setup.plugins.artikelvergleichen.xpl_art.name: Show the additional page contents in the comparison view
setup.plugins.artikelvergleichen.xpl_art.text: If you use additional pages to describe the article and the information on these pages is relevant for comparison, you should activate their display.

setup.plugins.artikelvergleichen.xpl_art.kurztext: Should the pop-up contain a link to the individual article?
setup.plugins.artikelvergleichen.xpl_art.name: Show article link in the comparison view
setup.plugins.artikelvergleichen.xpl_art.text: Activation of the article link is recommended in order to give the customer quick access to each article.

setup.plugins.artikelvergleichen.xpl_art.kurztext: Should the price appear in the pop-up?
setup.plugins.artikelvergleichen.xpl_art.name: Show price in the comparison view
setup.plugins.artikelvergleichen.xpl_art.text: It is recommended to activate the price display in the comparison view.

setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..name: Automatic beam import active
setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..text: If this option is active, a background process will continuously import article changes from the data provider. If this option is not acitve, the import can be also started manually at the beam import administration area.

setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..name: dynamically create missing categories
setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..text: If the imported articles refers to a category unknown in the shop, the category assignment will usually be discarded. Using this option however, you can let the import dynamically create the missing categories. They will be created as "hidden" initially having one language label only, as they are primarily created for backend use. After enrichment of the missing language texts, the dynamically created categories can be diplayed also in the frontend if desired.

setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..name: create missing categories as inactive
setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..text: If dynamically creating missing categories by the setup entry above, you can choose here if the created category shall be hidden by default if checked here or active if not. Kindly note that this option is only relevant at the time of creation of this category. Changing this option at a later time has no effect on already dynamically created categories.

setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..name: Base Category
setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..text:
When you fill in a category number here, the categories of the imported article will be saved as child categories of this category. We recommend creating a base category "import" and filling it in here, as well as rebuild the original category structure of the data provider within this category. You can then let this import category be visible with custom name to directly show the articles in their original category structure. Furthermore you can set any child categories you don't want to offer to "Display: hidden" in the category setup. Or you can hide the complete import category if you want to manually assign articles to your own categories.

If no category number is filled in here, the original category numbers will be used when importing the article.

setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..name: Interface Endpoint
setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..text: The Endpoint is the URL, the shop requests article data from. This value will be given by the data provider.

setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..name: Reimport all Articles
setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..text: Please only activate this option, if there is a need for a one time reimport of all article data. One possible reason could be adjusting the automatical price modification. Usually article updates will be imported automatically without need for a full reimport.

setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..name: import new articles as deactivated
setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..text:
Activate this option if you want newly imported articles to not be shown directly in the shop but to be thinned out or be altered manually. In this case newly imported articles will be set as deactivated by default.

Kindly note that you can select at any imported article whether this one shall be automatically activated/deactivated by the article provider or you want to activate/deactivate the article manually. The latter is set up by default for new articles when this setup option here is active.

setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..name: Reimport all Article Media
setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..text: Please only activate this option, if there is a need for a one time reimport of all article media. Usually media updates will be imported automatically without need for a full reimport.

setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..name: htaccess Password
setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..text:
When calling the endpoint URL in the browser, there may be a htacces login prompt in a separate popup window. Please fill in the same value here as you would do in the htaccess login prompt of the browser.

Leave this field empty if there is no htaccess login popup configured (considered potential browser caching).

setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..name: htaccess Username
setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..text:
When calling the endpoint URL in the browser, there may be a htacces login prompt in a separate popup window. Please fill in the same value here as you would do in the htaccess login prompt of the browser.

Leave this field empty if there is no htaccess login popup configured (considered potential browser caching).

setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..anzeigetitel: Default Setting: manually review these fields
setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..name: Default Setting: manually review these fields
setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..text:
Any field checked here will be handled as "manually review" in the article mask. This default setting determines, whether the appropriate checkbox in the article mask is checked by default or not (activated there if activated here). The default setting will be used until the individual article is saved and therefore its individual checkboxes are saved, which are considered prior to the default setting. In this case, the individual article has to be reviewed manually for incoming changes or the checkbox there must be deleted manually again.

If the checkbox for a field type is active, the appropriate field will only be imported with the initial import. Subsequent imports won't update this field value automatically. Therefore this only makes sense if you want to fix a field value, e.g. if you have made individual changes to it.

We recommend to not activate any of these checkboxes here by default and only activate them individually for each article.

setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..name: Automatical Price Modification
setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..text:
If a value is given here, the imported target price will be automatically adjusted by this value. Kindly note potential price policy restrictions by the data provider. Possible values here:

  • positive amount: price addition by the amount: "+0.01" for a price increase by 0.01
  • negative amount: price reduction by the amount: "+0.01" for a price decrease by 0.01
  • positive percentual value: price addition by the percentage: "+2.75%"
    • negative percentual value: price reduction by the percentage: "-2.75%"

setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..name: Secret Passphrase
setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..text: The secret passphrase will be given by the data provider

setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..name: Username
setup.plugins.beamimport.xpl_beamimport..text: The username will be given by the data provider

setup.plugins.bestands_handling.xpl_best.name: Show available quantity?
setup.plugins.bestands_handling.xpl_best.text:
when activated, the currently available quantity of the article will be displayed.

The setting can be overridden for individual items.

setup.plugins.bestands_handling.xpl_best.name: Maximum value for availability display
setup.plugins.bestands_handling.xpl_best.text: if higher than zero, availability counters will go only until this maximum value. Everything above will be shown as text (see below).

setup.plugins.bestands_handling.xpl_best.name: Text "highest value"
setup.plugins.bestands_handling.xpl_best.text: Text that will be displayed if the maximum value is reached (see above). Leave the field empty if you don't want to show any text here.

setup.plugins.bestands_handling.xpl_best.name: Text availability display
setup.plugins.bestands_handling.xpl_best.text: Text that will be displayed when the available quantity is > 0 and below a previous defined maximum limit. The %quantity% placeholder will then be replaced by a numerical value.

setup.plugins.bestands_handling.xpl_best.name: Text "Quantity cannot be ordered"
setup.plugins.bestands_handling.xpl_best.text: Text that will appear when "Prevent excess ordering" is activated and the available quantity is <=0 and therefore the article cannot be ordered.

setup.plugins.bestands_handling.xpl_best.kurztext: when activated, you can indicate in the statistics configuration order administration whether the warehouse availability of the ordered article should be written off. If you are using CosmoFAKTURA, this is obsolete and therefore has no effect.
setup.plugins.bestands_handling.xpl_best.name: Should the shop record inventory?
setup.plugins.bestands_handling.xpl_best.text:
If you activate this function, you can enter in the statistics configuration of the order management whether the available quantities of the article should be written off.
The shop records available quantities.
It is important that you always set the statistics correctly and the shop registers returns, for example.
If you also have cash sales, remaining quantities also have to be registered in the shop.

If you use CosmoFAKTURA, this function has no effect, as billing tracks inventory on its own.

setup.plugins.bestands_handling.xpl_best.name: Reserve stock?
setup.plugins.bestands_handling.xpl_best.text: If active, the items for all orders that aren't "finished" will be regarded as "reserved". Available quantities then reflect "Actual inventory" minus "Reserved inventory".

setup.plugins.bestands_handling.xpl_best.name: Shopping cart advisory text
setup.plugins.bestands_handling.xpl_best.text: The text that will appear when the customer's shopping cart must be reduced due to availability changes (to prevent excess orders)

setup.plugins.bestands_handling.xpl_best.name: Shopping cart lifetime
setup.plugins.bestands_handling.xpl_best.text:
Since the shop doesn't know when a customer has left the shop (except when an order is sent off), here it must be defined how many minutes (of inactivity) must pass before the articles in shopping carts become free again, or are not counted as "reserved" quantity.
Otherwise it can happen that 10 people each place 5 of the same article in the shopping cart, and since 50 pieces of this article are reserved, it can no longer be purchased (although these people have gone to lunch, having left the shop "open" in their browser).

setup.plugins.bestands_handling.xpl_best.name: Prevent excess ordering
setup.plugins.bestands_handling.xpl_best.text:
When activated, every article can be placed in the shopping cart only in maximally available quantities.
During the order process and before the end of the order, it will be constantly checked if the ordered quantity is available.
This setting can be overwritten individually ("Ignore excess ordering" in the article form under the "Inventory/Invoice" tab.

You should activate this feature if the article cannot be quickly restocked or if you sell unique pieces.

setup.plugins.bestseller.name: Bestsellers:
setup.plugins.bestseller.text:
Shopadmin: Configuration >> Plug-in settings >> Bestsellers

Setting options for the bestseller box found in the right shop bar (below the mini shopping cart).

Activating this function generally
defines how many bestsellers should be shown together.
Should bestsellers be shown with or without a thumbnail?
- if with, should the thumbnails be no wider than allowed to avoid disturbing the shop layout.

If you want to show bestsellers starting from a certain price threshold, indicate a minimum value from which an article can appear in the bestseller box.

setup.plugins.bestseller.xpl_bestseller..kurztext: general activation of the bestseller list
setup.plugins.bestseller.xpl_bestseller..name: bestseller list activation
setup.plugins.bestseller.xpl_bestseller..text:
The bestseller list is an automatic cross-selling function.

The products ordered most often will be shown in a list. Shop visitors will immediately see where to find the best-selling products in your shop.

setup.plugins.bestseller.xpl_bestseller..name: Number of shown bestsellers in shop

setup.plugins.bestseller.xpl_bestseller..kurztext: shows images in the bestseller list
setup.plugins.bestseller.xpl_bestseller..name: display images in the bestseller list
fitting bestseller to each selected category
setup.plugins.bestseller.xpl_bestseller..text: Here you can select whether only bestsellers from the currently selected category and its sub-categories should be shown in the category views. Alternatively, the main category bestsellers can also be shown (in important sub-categories) or no category limitations can be applied.

setup.plugins.bestseller.xpl_bestseller..kurztext: only articles with this minimum value will appear as bestsellers.
setup.plugins.bestseller.xpl_bestseller..name: Minimum merchandise value of counted bestsellers
setup.plugins.bestseller.xpl_bestseller..text: To prevent display of commonly ordered consumables, you can define a minimum merchandise value here.

setup.plugins.billpay.name: Billpay purchase on account
setup.plugins.billpay.text:
Purchase on account with no risk.
Here you can administer the parameter for this payment interface.
You can find more information here:

http://www.billpay.de

 

The payment method required for Billpay needs the following text in the billing text field:
(Placeholders between percent symbols have to stay as is)

Please transfer the invoice amount by %termofpayment% to

account number: %accountnumber%
BIN: %bankbin%
Bank: %bankname%
Reference: %purpose%

setup.plugins.billpay.xpl_billpay.Billpa.anzeigetitel: Note: Credit assessment has not been accepted (Billpay)
setup.plugins.billpay.xpl_billpay.Billpa.name: Note: Credit assessment has not been accepted (Billpay)
setup.plugins.billpay.xpl_billpay.Billpa.text: If credit assessment is not accepted when paying with Billpay, this payment method cannot be selected and the error message prepared here will appear.

setup.plugins.billpay.xpl_billpay.Billpa.name: Note; Billpay_installments_not_selected
setup.plugins.billpay.xpl_billpay.Billpa.text: If Billpay installment payments are selected as the payment method without selecting a monthly rate option, this error message will appear.

setup.plugins.billpay.xpl_billpay.billpa.kurztext: when inactive, the test mode will be used, where all payments are only simulated. Correct access data is still required for the test mode. Billpay will tell you what this is.
setup.plugins.billpay.xpl_billpay.billpa.name: Billpay Live Mode
setup.plugins.billpay.xpl_billpay.billpa.text: when inactive, the test mode will be used, where all payments are only simulated. Correct access data is still required for the test mode. Billpay will tell you what this is. You can find information about transaction modes here

setup.plugins.billpay.xpl_billpay.billpa.name: Billpay Merchant ID
setup.plugins.billpay.xpl_billpay.billpa.text: You can set up a merchant account here

setup.plugins.billpay.xpl_billpay.billpa.name: Billpay portal ID
setup.plugins.billpay.xpl_billpay.billpa.text: You can set up a merchant account here

setup.plugins.billpay.xpl_billpay.billpa.name: Billpay security key
setup.plugins.billpay.xpl_billpay.billpa.text: You can set up a merchant account here

setup.plugins.billpay.xpl_billpay.billpa.kurztext: Kindly note that your Payment Service Provider (PSP) has to support the selected method. Please contact your PSP to find out, from when respectively until when the methods will be supported.
setup.plugins.billpay.xpl_billpay.billpa.name: Show SEPA fields in the bank account form
setup.plugins.billpay.xpl_billpay.billpa.text:
You can choose here, if you want to show whether the SEPA fields (BIC/IBAN) or the classic Account Number / BIN) within the bank account form.

Kindly note that your Payment Service Provider (PSP) has to support the selected method. Please contact your PSP to find out, from when respectively until when the methods will be supported.

setup.plugins.billpay.xpl_billpay.billpa.name: URL for the Billpay live system
setup.plugins.billpay.xpl_billpay.billpa.text: If Billpay's URLs change, you can update you shop with these changes.

setup.plugins.billpay.xpl_billpay.billpa.name: URL for Billpay's test system
setup.plugins.billpay.xpl_billpay.billpa.text: If Billpay's URLs change, you can update you shop with these changes.

setup.plugins.billsafe.xpl_billsafe.bill.name: ApplicationSignature BillSAFE
setup.plugins.billsafe.xpl_billsafe.bill.text: You can the ApplicationSignature from BillSAFE. A merchant account can be opened here .

setup.plugins.billsafe.xpl_billsafe.bill.name: BillSAFE payment failed
setup.plugins.billsafe.xpl_billsafe.bill.text: When BillSAFE denies payment, the customer will see the following message.

setup.plugins.billsafe.xpl_billsafe.bill.anzeigetitel: Error text different delivery address BillSAFE
setup.plugins.billsafe.xpl_billsafe.bill.name: Error text different delivery address BillSAFE
setup.plugins.billsafe.xpl_billsafe.bill.text: BillSAFE doesn't allow any different delivery addresses. If a customer entered a different delivery address, this error message will appear.

setup.plugins.billsafe.xpl_billsafe.bill.kurztext: Live mode of the BillSAFE payment interface
setup.plugins.billsafe.xpl_billsafe.bill.name: BillSAFE live mode
setup.plugins.billsafe.xpl_billsafe.bill.text: Activate this checkbox if you have received the live data from BillSAFE and configured the interface in the shop. Payments will then be booked via the BillSAFE live system.

setup.plugins.billsafe.xpl_billsafe.bill.name: BillSAFE license

setup.plugins.bueroware.xpl_bueroware.sh.kurztext: (Required for interface configuration of the BüroWare page)

setup.plugins.ccbank.name: CC Bank interface:
setup.plugins.ccbank.text:
offers shop visitors the option to finance their purchase.
Especially recommended for expensive articles.
The customer will be offered "Financing" along with the usual payment methods.
If this "Payment method" is selected, the Santander Bank logo and link will appear. Clicking on it leads to the CC Bank financing section. All parameters of the order are already communicated and therefore the order confirmation number, total amount, etc. are already available.

On this page you can enter your assigned merchant number, assigned to you by Santander Bank.
In the "Order process"->"Payment methods" please create a new payment method, save the identification (CC Bank/financing) and make sure that the shipping methods link is correct, or activate the new "Payment method" in the country management.

setup.plugins.ccbank.xpl_ccbank.ccbank_i.name: CC Bank merchant number
setup.plugins.ccbank.xpl_ccbank.ccbank_i.text:
CC Bank enables financing in the shop.

Further information is available at www.santander.de

setup.plugins.ceg.name: Creditreform Boniversum:
setup.plugins.ceg.text:
checks your customers' credit rating right after they enter their address information.
Based on the received credit score, the payment methods can be automatically limited without the customer noticing.
Customers with low credit scores will then see advance payment instead of the risky direct debit, for example

As a rule, activate this module on this page.
In addition, you have to set various parameters that you will receive after you have signed your contract with Creditreform Boniversum.
You can also sign up for or activate the useful address correction that checks the entered address for typos and corrects it if needed.
If existing customers should be checked only once, check the appropriate box. Otherwise, all customers will be checked once.

setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.CEG_Adresse_ko.name: Note; Creditreform Boniversum address corrected
setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.CEG_Adresse_ko.text: If the Creditreform Boniversum interface is activated, addresses will be automatically corrected if the entry has small typos. The customer will be notified by an error message that you can set.

setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.CEG_Adressfehl.anzeigetitel: Error; Creditreform Boniversum  address field check
setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.CEG_Adressfehl.name: Error; Creditreform Boniversum  address field check
setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.CEG_Adressfehl.text: If the Creditreform Boniversum interface is activated, the entered address is checked. If it doesn't exist, an error message you can administrate will appear here.

setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.CEG_Systemfehl.name: Error; Creditreform Boniversum system error
setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.CEG_Systemfehl.text: If the Creditreform Boniversum interface is activated, it can sometimes happen that the Creditreform Boniversum checking server is unavailable. In this case, an error message you can administrate here will appear.

setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.ceg_adresskorr.kurztext: when activated, a Creditreform Boniversum message will appear with incorrect entries that weren't automatically corrected. If inactive, a shop text will appear that can be altered using templates.
setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.ceg_adresskorr.name: Address correction note
setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.ceg_adresskorr.text:
Wwhen this function is activated, a Creditreform Boniversum message explains what exactly is wrong with the address (in case this couldn't be corrected automatically).

If not activated, a shop text will appear, which can be altered using templates. (Design/layout -> Manage templates)

setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.ceg_aktiv.kurztext: General activation of Creditreform Boniversum credit checks
setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.ceg_aktiv.name: Creditreform Boniversum credit checks
setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.ceg_aktiv.text:
Creditreform Boniversum makes it possible to check your shop customers' credit rating.

Further information available at www.ceg-plus.de

setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.ceg_automatisc.kurztext:
If possible, correct address automatically
(removes obvious typos in the address)
setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.ceg_automatisc.name: Automatic address correction
setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.ceg_automatisc.text:
The Creditreform Boniversum interface offers the option to check a customer's address for obvious typos and automatically correct these.
This creates "cleaner" data and lowers the rate of returned shipments.

setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.ceg_blocken_be.kurztext:
Orders with wrong and uncorrectable addresses will be blocked if they cannot be automatically fixed. 
Note: Foreign addresses will always be allowed.
setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.ceg_blocken_be.name: Creditreform Boniversum blocking in case of incorrect entries
setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.ceg_blocken_be.text:
Orders with wrong and uncorrectable addresses will be blocked if they cannot be automatically corrected.
For this reason the customer can't get to the checkout area without entering a valid address.

Warning: International addresses will not be blocked even when this setting is activated.

setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.ceg_hidoperato.name: Username
setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.ceg_hidoperato.text: Please enter the information provided by Creditreform Boniversum here.

setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.ceg_manual_agg.kurztext: This parameter is expected of Creditreform Boniversum as part of the Federal Privacy Protection legislation and ensures that either you as the shop operator have informed your customers about the recording of their information by Creditreform Boniversum, or that Creditreform Boniversum has done this itself. If this option isn't active, the customer will receive a notification about their data being saved by Creditreform Boniversum after the initial query with Creditreform Boniversum.

setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.ceg_manual_agg.text: This parameter is expected of Creditreform Boniversum as part of the Federal Privacy Protection legislation and ensures that either you as the shop operator have informed your customers about the recording of their information by Creditreform Boniversum, or that Creditreform Boniversum has done this itself. If this option isn't active, the customer will receive a notification about their data being saved by Creditreform Boniversum after the initial query with Creditreform Boniversum.

setup.plugins.ceg.xpl_ceg.ceg_refresh_ta.text:

setup.plugins.clickandbuy.name: ClickandBuy
setup.plugins.clickandbuy.text: Here you can register yourself as a merchant for the payment interface ClickandBuy. The interface parameters will be filled in automatically. If you have received other parameters, you can also enter them manually.

setup.plugins.clickandbuy.xpl_clickandbu.kurztext: general activation of the ClickandBuy interface
setup.plugins.clickandbuy.xpl_clickandbu.name: Activation of the ClickandBuy interface
setup.plugins.clickandbuy.xpl_clickandbu.text:
Here you can generally activate the ClickandBuy interface.

setup.plugins.clickandbuy.xpl_clickandbu.kurztext: Enter your ClickandBuy encryption key here.

setup.plugins.clickandbuy.xpl_clickandbu.text:

setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.name: Zoomer active
setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.text: When active, the Cloud Zoom is used in the product details page of the shop, for to provide the zoom effect for the article images. Even when disabled here, you can still maintain the zoomer images in the shop's backoffice.

setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.name: Additional Images Selection
setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.text:
If additional images were associated with variants or combinations of variants, you can define here whether the pre-selection of the variant dropdowns should already be selected when hovering the additional image with your mouse, or only when you click on the additional image. In combination with the additional image behavior, this results in the following three useful cases:

1) Additional image behavior: click, additional image selection: click: when you click on an additional image, the article image is replaced with the zoom image, and if assigned, the article variant matching the image version is also preselected.

2) Additional image behavior: mouse-over, additional image-selection: click: when hovering an additional image with your mouse, the article image is replaced with the zoom image. The pre-selection of the matching variant will only happen with a dedicated mouse click in addition.

3) Additional image behavior: mouse-over, additional image-selection: mouse-Over: when hovering an additional image with your mouse, the article image is replaced with the zoom image, and the pre-selection of the matching variant will happen instantly.

setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.name: Additional pictures behaviour
setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.text:
You can define the default behaviour of additional article images regarding the zooming here. In addition, you can define the behaviour inside each article if needed (in the "Manage Article Images" area), overriding this default behaviour.

The additional images zoom behavior setup has these options:

- when clicking - the image will be replaced when clicking the additional image. Zoomable if there is a large additional picture available

- when hovering - the image will be automatically replaced when hovering the additional image. Zoomable if there is a large additional picture available

- no zooming - as default, the zoomer for the additional images will be inactive. This option can be used, if you want to use the additional images zoomer only for dedicated articles, and override this rule in the specific article setup.

setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.name: Activate Auto-Inside?
setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.text:
If the zoom image should not be shown in any case within the article image, the image can be displayed depends on the browser width automatically "within the article image" when the browser a minimum width (as specified below) below.

This prevents that the Zoom picture is cut off from Broser-edge: If the browser is wide enough, the zoom picture is displayed next to the item picture, if not then within.

setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.name: Auto-Inside Browser Width
setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.text:
If Auto-Inside is enabled, the browser width can be specified here, which must be at least present to get the zoom image is displayed next to the item image. The browser width is dependent on the size and position of the article image and the size and position of the zoomed picture. The required value here, you can determine the following manner:

  • configure the position and size of zoom image as desired
  • open the detailed view of a representative article, which has a zoom image
  • enlarge / shrink the browser width so far that the zoom image is just so fully visible
  • you'll create a screenshot of the page and open this screenshot in a graphics program such as Paint or Gimp
  • in the graphics program you drag a selection box around the displayed browser. Even while dragging the selection frame you should (as in the footer of the program) can read the width and height of the selection.
  • Read now the width of the browser window and enter it in this configuration field.

setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.name: Zoom image height
setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.text: if the zoom image is to be displayed besides the article image, you can specify the height of the zoom image here. Only functional in combination with a zoom image width.

setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.name: Image preloading
setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.text:
when this option is active, the zoom images will be preloaded and are ready as soon as a hover happens. If deactivated, there might be some latency between hovering and having a zoom picture displayed.

We strongly reccomend not to use this option, unless there is an explicit need, for this will cause a lot of additional traffic for you as well as your customer, if the zoom images are large.

setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.name: No automatical large image scaling
setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.text:
the automatical scaling of large article images using the image wizard will be disabled, when activation this option hiere. As default (when is option is not active), large article images will also be scaled to a screen fitting size. When using a zoomer, you explicitly don't want this behaviour, and thus can be deactivated here.

The deactivation has also effect on the large additional images, when using the wizard there.

setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.anzeigetitel: Horizontal offset of the zoom image
setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.name: Horizontal offset of the zoom image
setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.text: if the zoom image is to be displayed besides the article image, you can specify the horizontal offset to the article image's border her. Provide a positive number for shifting right, an a negative for shifting left.

setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.anzeigetitel: Vertical offset of the zoom image
setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.name: Vertical offset of the zoom image
setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.text: if the zoom image is to be displayed besides the article image, you can specify the vertical offset to the article image's border her. Provide a positive number for shifting down, an a negative for shifting up.

setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.name: Zoom image width
setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.text: if the zoom image is to be displayed besides the article image, you can specify the width of the zoom image here. Only functional in combination with a zoom image height.

setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.name: Position of the zoom area
setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.text:
Here you can specify, whether the zoom area should be shown within the article image or outside (and if, where outside). For example: chosing "left, aligned to bottom", the zoom image will be displayed left of the article image, aligned to the bottom.

When displaying outside of the article image, you can also specify a horizontal/vertical offset to the article image, as well as the pixel size of the zoom area.

setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.name: Zoom behaviour
setup.plugins.cloudzoom.xpl_cloudzoom.cl.text:
You can define the default behaviour of the zoomer here. In addition, you can define the behaviour inside each article if needed (in the "Manage Article Images" area), overriding this default behaviour.

The zoom behavior setup has these options:

- use large article picture - here the large article picture will always be used as zoom image (if defined). Kindly note that it would be reasonable to deactivate the automatic rescaling of large images (deactivation possible within this plugin setup), and then upload a high resolution image using the image wizard. In this case, the high resolution image will be saved as large pic in its original size, while thumbnail and normal image will be rescaled as usual. This way you ensure that the normal image will be - except for the resolution - the identical image as the zoom image.

- use dedicated zoom image -you can (independant of the large article image) upload a special zoom image. If such an image has been uploaded and this option is active, it will be used for the zoomer, or the zoomer will be deactivated if there is none specified. The regular large picture will then be not used for the zoomer under any circumstances. Kindly note, that the special zoom image will have to have the same aspect ratio and the same content as the normal article image.

- no zooming - as default, the zoomer will be inactive. This option can be used, if you want to use the zoomer only for dedicated articles, and override this rule in the specific article setup.

setup.plugins.conversion.name: Conversion + tracking codes:
setup.plugins.conversion.text:
Conversion tracking codes are used to trace statistics of other origins to the shop. If a click that brought the ordering customer to the shop took place on a different page (such as Google), you need the tracking function in order to analyze the whole process, e.g. using Google Analytics.

You will find the following options on this page:

Partner merchants
An external partner program that allows operation your own partner program (not a global partner program such as Zanox)
With this function you can dock the partner merchant to the shop.
You can find more information at www.partnerseller.com

Superclix
This is also an external partner program that can be embedded into the shop.

Google conversion tracking
For the Google-internal module.
This is how you can find out which clicks (such as Google Adwords) really led to purchases in your shop.

Google Analytics
Google's internal statistics program.
Comprehensive evaluations of clicks and visitor flow.
You can find out more at Google in the login area.

setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..kurztext: The opt-out link is displayed under the privacy page (selectable below).
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..name: Display Analytics Opt-Out Link
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..text:
Provide your customers with a way to disable Google / Universal Analytics tracking for each visitor.

The Opt-Out link should be displayed under the Privacy page. Please select a field below.

setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..name: Analytics Opt-Out Service Pages
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..text:
Here you can select under which additional page the Analytics Opt-Out link is displayed.
The privacy page should be selected.

setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..anzeigetitel: anonymous Google analytics of customer IPs (old)
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..kurztext: Analytics code expanded to anonymize visitor IP address
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..name: anonymous Google analytics of customer IPs
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..text:
_anonymizeIp()

Expansion of the Google analytics code provides the option to anonymize visitor IPs.

It is recommended to activate this option.

The disadvantage of activating this option is a slightly less precise visitor region determination in Google Analytics statistics.

setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..anzeigetitel: anonymous customer IPs at Google Universal Analytics
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..kurztext: Universal Analytics-Code Expansion for anonymous visitor IP addresses
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..name: anonymous customer IPs at Google Universal Analytics
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..text:
Expansion of the Google analytics code provides the option to anonymize visitor IPs.

It is recommended to activate this option for customer privacy reasons.

The disadvantage of activating this option is a slightly less precise visitor region determination in Google Analytics statistics.

setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..kurztext: Google conversion tracking code will be embedded. It is functional only in combination with the Google Conversion ID.
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..name: Google conversion tracking
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..text: When using an SSL proxy in the order process, the conversion tracking function cannot function continuously. We strongly recommend your own SSL certificate. We are happy to advise you.

setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..kurztext: Enter the value provided to you by Google as google_conversion_color (standard: CCCCCC (=black)).
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..name: Conversion box color
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..text: Google conversion color is the color of the little box displayed by Google on the "Success page" (where conversion is measured).

setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..kurztext: Enter the value provided to you by Google as google_conversion_color (no quotes).
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..name: Google conversion ID
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..text:
If you use conversion tracking from Google, you can evaluate whether a click from a certain web page led to the desired success.
The definition of success can be specifically defined, such as being a query, purchase, registration, etc.

Conversion tracking is possible only in combination with Google Adwords. (www.google.de/adwords/)

Enter the Conversion ID here so that Google can identify you appropriately to assign the "conversion".

setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..kurztext: Enter the value provided by Google as google_conversion_label (standard: purchase). Not necessary for cross channel conversions.
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..name: Google Conversion Label
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..text:
Enter the value provided by Google as google_conversion_label (standard: purchase). Not necessary for cross channel conversions.

This code will be given to you when you set up Google Adwords.

setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..kurztext: enter here whether you want to use conversion tracking or cross channel conversion tracking from Google. WARNING: Cross channel new registrations are no longer supported.
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..name: Google conversion mode
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..text: Recommended: Standard
