setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..kurztext: Should Google conversion tracking count the number of orders or the total of gross final amounts? Can't be used for cross channel conversions. (net = without taxes and delivery charges)
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..name: Google conversion counting method
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..text:
With this setting, you determine what type of conversion you would like to count.

Case 1: Number of clicks that led to an order

Case 2: Order value total that resulted from a click.

setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..kurztext: the Conversion Tracking Code from partnerseller.com is embedded. It is functional only in combination with the Partnerseller URL
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..name: Activate the Partnerseller interface
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..text: More information: www.partnerseller.com

setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..kurztext: Please enter the Partnerseller conversion script URL, such as http://www.my-domain.de/partnerseller/sold.php. Partnerseller will provide you with the URL.
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..name: Partnerseller Affiliate System
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..text:
Please enter the Partnerseller conversion script URL, such as http://www.my-domain.com/partnerseller/sold.phpPartnerseller will provide you with the URL and the necessary parameters will be automatically inserted by the shop.

With Partnerseller you can operate your own partner program, or use it for advertising costs analysis.

For more information visit

www.partnerseller.com

setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..kurztext: Superclix conversion tracking code will be embedded. It is functional only in combination with the Superclix partner program ID
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..name: Activate Superclix
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..text:
Superclix is an affiliate/partner program.
With this setting you can activate the system and sales will be communicated from the shop to the Superclix office. There, sales can be assigned to the commission rates agreed on by partners.

setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..kurztext: Please enter the Superclix partner program number (not the customer number!)
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..name: Superclix partner program ID
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..text:
If you have activated Superclix, enter your Superclix ID so that the system works.
Superclix will provide you with the ID.

setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..kurztext: the Google Analytics tracking code will be embedded. It is functional only in combination with the Google Analytics ID.
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..name: Google Analytics
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..text:
Google Analytics is a free service for websites and online shops.
We absolutely recommend using it. Together with Google conversion tracking, it allows analysis of advertising measures.

More information: http://www.google.com/analytics/

setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..kurztext: Enter the value provided by Google as _uacct (without quotes). The ID presumably begins with UA-
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..name: Google Analytics ID
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..text:
Enter the value provided by Google as _uacct (without quotes).
The ID presumably begins with UA-XXXX

You can find more information here: www.google.com/analytics/

setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..kurztext: the Google Universal Analytics tracking code will be embedded. It is functional only in combination with the Google Universal Analytics ID.
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..name: activate Google Universal Analytics tracking
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..text:
Google Universal Analytics is a free service for websites and online shops.

We absolutely recommend using it. Together with Google conversion tracking, it allows analysis of advertising measures. More information: http://www.google.com/analytics/

Kindly note that Google Universal Analytics is a successor of the former Google Anlaytics, therefore we recommend using the Universal Analytics instead of the classic Analytics. To use Universal Analytics with an existing classic Analytics account, you have to migrate your account to Universal Analytics on the Analytics web page. More information: https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/3450662?hl=en&ref_topic=6010376

setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..kurztext: Enter the value provided by Google. The ID presumably begins with UA-
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..name: Google Universal Analytics ID
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..text:
Enter the value provided by Google.

The ID presumably begins with UA-XXXX

You can find more information here: www.google.com/analytics/

setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..name: Zanox ID
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..text:
Zanox will provide you with a tracking code that looks something like this:

src="http://ad.zanox.com/pps/?4711C081512345&mode=[[1]]&CID=[[xxx]]&CustomerID=[[XXX]]&OrderID=[[XXX]]&SubOrderID=[[xxx]]&CurrencySymbol=[[XXX]]&TotalPrice=[[XXX]]&CommissionFix=[[xxx]]&CommissionPercent=[[xxx]]&SessionID=[[xxx]]&PartnerID=[[xxx]]&ReviewNote=[[xxx]]&MaturityDate=[[xxx]]"

You can read the Zanox ID directly from this URL. It is found behind the only question mark and and continues until the first ampersand, and in this example is 4711C081512345

This ID must be entered here, not the entire tracking code

setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..name: Zanox currency code
setup.plugins.conversion.xpl_conversion..text:
possible values are:

  • EUR for Euro
  • USD for US Dollar
  • GBP for British Pound
  • CHF for Swiss Franc
  • PLN for Polish Zloty
  • SEK for Swedish Krones

setup.plugins.cosmoapi.xpl_cosmoapi.apiA.kurztext: allow the API to change articles
setup.plugins.cosmoapi.xpl_cosmoapi.apiA.name: change articles

setup.plugins.cosmoapi.xpl_cosmoapi.apiA.kurztext: allow the API to change orders
setup.plugins.cosmoapi.xpl_cosmoapi.apiA.name: change orders

setup.plugins.desc.adbutler.name: Adbutler
setup.plugins.desc.adbutler.text: Is an affiliate system which can be embedded with this module so that purchases made through AdButler can be communicated back to Adbutler.

setup.plugins.desc.afterbuy.name: Afterbuy interface
setup.plugins.desc.afterbuy.text: Order export to Afterbuy in order to be able to use its transaction system.

setup.plugins.desc.amazon.name: Amazon article export
setup.plugins.desc.amazon.text: With this module you can import article data in the correct format for import via Sellercentral.

setup.plugins.desc.amazon_LPA.kurztext:
Start an Amazon Pay Merchant Account with few clicks here.

You can find the relevant access data afterwards at http://sellercentral-europe.amazon.com/hz/me/integration/details . The Instant Payment Notification URL of your shop for filling in at the Amazon SellerCentral is:
setup.plugins.desc.amazon_LPA.name: Payment module: Amazon Pay (LPA)
setup.plugins.desc.amazon_LPA.text:
This plugin provides the payment service "Amazon Pay", formerly known as "Login & Pay with Amazon" (LPA). Kindly note that there are older version of this payment service called "Checkout by Amazon" (CBA) and "Amazon Payments Advanced API" (APA).

Please prefer this LPA plugin in case, because it provides more functionality than the old versions CBA or APA

Kindly note that the fields marked with an * are mandatory fields and have to be filled in correctly.

As an option, you can enter the Instant Payment Notification URL provided here in your Amazon's SellerCentral. In this case status feedbacks on behalf of amazon are synchronized with the shop. The Amazon LPA Interface is fully functional without providing ths URL, but we recommend filling it in.

setup.plugins.desc.amazon_advanced_payme.name: Payment module: Amazon Advanced Payments (APA)
setup.plugins.desc.amazon_advanced_payme.text:
This plugin provides the payment service "Amazon Payments Advanced API". Kindly note that there is an older version of this payment service called "Checkout by Amazon".

Please prefer this "Amazon Payments Advanced API" plugin in case, because it provides more functionality than the old version.

setup.plugins.desc.angebot_statt_kauf.name: Offer request instead of purchase of products
setup.plugins.desc.angebot_statt_kauf.text:
The module allows the shop visitor not to buy items directly, but to put them in a "request basket".

He then asks these articles. Only the address input is necessary in the POS area, all further steps are skipped.

setup.plugins.desc.artikel_videos.name: YouTube/Flash movies
setup.plugins.desc.artikel_videos.text:
With this module Youtube films can easily be integrated as an alternative to the article image.

All you have to do is insert the URL of the movie (or the pure cryptic part of the URL) into an input field, the rest is done by the shop alone.

The window size of the video player can be set in the plugin.

setup.plugins.desc.artikelvergleichen.name: Article comparison function
setup.plugins.desc.artikelvergleichen.text:
You can compare any number of articles to each other with one button/link.

Comparison takes place in a pop-up window, where all articles are placed next to each other.

setup.plugins.desc.attribute.name: Attribute management
setup.plugins.desc.attribute.text:
With this module you can assign various attributes (describing your items such as color, material, workmanship, condition, etc) to your articles.

A positive side effect is:

- better listing with Google products/ merchant center

- possible use of filter search

setup.plugins.desc.benchmark.name: Developer plug-in: Benchmarks
setup.plugins.desc.benchmark.text:
only for developers:

with the help of the Benchmark plug-in you can set measuring points at any point in the code. The time analysis of all measuring points takes place through Cosmo::Debug on the side. The Benchmark plug-in has no visible effects in normal operation (with deactivated debug feature).

setup.plugins.desc.beny.name: Beny Repricing
setup.plugins.desc.beny.text:
The module binds the repricing provider "BENY" to the CosmoShop.

This means that products can be automatically changed in price, which can provide competitive advantages.

http://www.beny-repricing.de/

setup.plugins.desc.bestands_handling.name: Inventory keeping in the shop
setup.plugins.desc.bestands_handling.text:
This module gives your shop the capability to keep track of inventory.
You can set various thresholds that play the role of a red stoplight, limiting availability, etc.
All inventory bookings are logged for each article.
Overselling can be avoided with the help of inventory control.
If you do, however, want to follow the "always in stock" principle, there is no need to do inventory control in your shop.

setup.plugins.desc.bestellhistorie.name: Order history
setup.plugins.desc.bestellhistorie.text: Order history makes it possible for customers to follow and view their orders in the "My Account" shop area.

setup.plugins.desc.bestseller.name: Bestseller function
setup.plugins.desc.bestseller.text:
The article with the highest purchase rate (sold item count) will be displayed in a box in the shop.

Including preview image, name, price, place.

setup.plugins.desc.bueroware.name: CosmoSYNC BüroWARE interface
setup.plugins.desc.bueroware.text: Bidirectional interface for embedding the "BüroWARE" merchandise manager.

setup.plugins.desc.bundles.name: Bundle Articles
setup.plugins.desc.bundles.text:
Using this plugin, you can compose a bundle (collection of articles). You create a new article and assign the bundle components just as you would assign accessories. The buncle components may be normal articles or variants/combinations, each in any quantity. You can define either a percentual discount/surcharge for each component or a fixed bundle price ignoring any component prices.

If the stock control of the shop is active, it will work together with bundle articles. So bundle articles will adopt the availability an quantity of the weakest component. If any component is sold out, the bundle will be sold out as well. Additionally you can limit the stock of the bundle itself as well. So if the Bundle is a promotional article and the stock control of the bundle is configured well, the bundle is only orderable a fixed number of times until ist is sold out, independently of its component availability.

setup.plugins.desc.ccbank.name: Payment module: Santander Financing
setup.plugins.desc.ccbank.text:
With this module, you can offer the financing of purchased goods via Santander Bank.

The shopping cart is transferred to the financing section after the order has been completed.

There is, however, no return channel to the shop. The confirmation of financing comes directly from the Santanderbank via mail.

setup.plugins.desc.ceg.name: Creditreform Boniversum credit check
setup.plugins.desc.ceg.text: CEG interface for the test of shopkeepers on credit rating. Scoring can then be used to limit the number of payment types.

setup.plugins.desc.cloudzoom.name: Cloud Zoom
setup.plugins.desc.cloudzoom.text:
Cloud Zoom is an image scaling tool implemented in the article detail view of the shop. With the Cloud Zoom, you have the ability to provide a high resolution variant of the regular article image, for to show a zoomed out part of the image when hovering the image.

Depending on image size and positioning of the article images in the detail view, you have the free choice, whether to show the magnification inside of the article image or besides the article image.

To ease the image management you can turn off the automatic scaling of large image pictures using the image wizard here, for to simply upload high resolution images with the wizard, and having the high resolution original image simply within the large article image. You can either upload the images manually or use the wizard import within the article images import mask, especially if you want to upload several image at once.

Additionally to the regular article images, the zoomer can also be used for the additional article images. Here you are also free to upload the images easily using the wizard or the wizard import.

As an alternative for using the large article images as zoom base, you can also upload special zoom images for the articles. Kindly note, that the the normal and zoom images may only differ in resolution, not content.

You can also manage the zoom behaviour individually for each article in the "load images" mask if you like, or specify there to use the global settings (as active at default)

Kindly note, that you can alter the lens and zoom area style as needed within the template "Article Imagesr" under "CSS (Design)".

setup.plugins.desc.conversion.name: Tracking & Conversion
setup.plugins.desc.conversion.text:
There are several external tools to track and analyze page impressions of the shop (like Google Analytics). Using this plugin, you can activate common trackings and conversions by simply filling out the form fields below.

In addition, you can alter or extend the predefined tracking and conversion codes directly in these templates:

  • Shop -> Frame Templates -> Tracking Codes : for the page footer of the shop Shop-Bereich
  • Checkout -> Frame Templates -> Tracking Codes : for the page footer of the checkout
  • Checkout -> Page Content -> Step 6 -> Conversion Codes : for the conversion tracking

We reccomend not altering the predefined codes until there is an imminent need.

setup.plugins.desc.cosmoapi.name: CosmoAPI
setup.plugins.desc.cosmoapi.text:
Activates the API interface, with which all data can be imported into the system or even pulled out.

Thus, for example, section, article, customer, order data, etc. can be stored. With this interface.

setup.plugins.desc.cosmofaktura_mail.name: Shop invoice order export mail
setup.plugins.desc.cosmofaktura_mail.text:
With this function you can send orders from the shop as emails in a format that is readable for machines.

The external billing program then reads this email and can process the shop's orders.

Please note that you don't need this function if you use our internal CosmoFAKTURA. In this case, orders will be automatically passed on to CosmoFAKTURA.

setup.plugins.desc.downloadshop.name: Download articles
setup.plugins.desc.downloadshop.text:
Used to deliver electronic products such as manuals, MP3, program files, etc.

Only after successful payment will the customer be delivered a download link (in a 2-key procedure).

setup.plugins.desc.econda.name: Econda statistics
setup.plugins.desc.econda.text: An alternative to Google Analytics and shop-internal statistics. More information at: www.econda.com

setup.plugins.desc.einheiten.name: Unit management
setup.plugins.desc.einheiten.text:
helps the shop administrate units such as liters, grams, kilograms, square meters, etc.
Some units have to be related to the base price of an article according to price regulations.
The shop can calculate this automatically as long as you indicate the contained amount in the article and its units. This places you on the right side of the law.

setup.plugins.desc.ekomi.name: eKomi shop rating
setup.plugins.desc.ekomi.text: The shop and customer rating system "ekomi" can be connected with this module.

setup.plugins.desc.empfehlung.name: Article recommendations
setup.plugins.desc.empfehlung.text:
Customers who bought this article also liked x, y...

This module shows fitting products under the article detail view.

This is controlled automatically based on made purchases.

setup.plugins.desc.faktura.name: CosmoFaktura
setup.plugins.desc.faktura.text:
Internal billing system that can be integrated directly into the shop.

With it, you can issue delivery bills, invoices, returns, credit notes, etc.

Embedding your shipping service provider, the bank, DATEV and others is possible.

setup.plugins.desc.flash_artikelbilder.kurztext: Use Flash technology for article images
setup.plugins.desc.flash_artikelbilder.name: Flash article images

setup.plugins.desc.froogle.name: Google Base article export
setup.plugins.desc.froogle.text: The module creates an export format specifically for Google Products / Merchants.

setup.plugins.desc.google_sitemaps.name: Google site maps
setup.plugins.desc.google_sitemaps.text:
A must-have module for all shop operators.
This module creates the xml sitemap required by Google webmasters.
This lets Google create a better and deeper index.

setup.plugins.desc.gutschein.name: Coupon module
setup.plugins.desc.gutschein.text:
A must-have module for all shop operators. Lets you create manual and automatic vouchers.
You can create multi-use and simple redeemable vouchers.
The newsletter system is also connected to the coupon module, so that any newsletter recipient can receive an individual coupon code.

setup.plugins.desc.kombinationen.name: Article combinations
setup.plugins.desc.kombinationen.text:
You need this module in case various versions of your products can't be combined with each other.

For example, you can specify that the red t-shirt is only available in XL, but the size isn't available in green.

setup.plugins.desc.lexikon.name: Lexicon
setup.plugins.desc.lexikon.text:
The lexicon function underlines all the words which have been previously defined and explained in the backend.

If you then move with the mouse over this word, the explanation from the lexicon appears as a tooltip.

setup.plugins.desc.liveshopping.name: Live shopping
setup.plugins.desc.liveshopping.text: Articles can be listed with a different price and description text for a certain period of time on the start page and an additional page.

setup.plugins.desc.massenpflege.name: Mass maintenance / mass editing
setup.plugins.desc.massenpflege.text:
This useful function makes it possible to apply field article management changes to all articles at once.
Example: You would like to change the availability of all articles with the world "school bag". To do this, use the search to find all the articles and then select "Edit availability" in the dropdown menu.
All of the articles will appear on the next page one after the other including the availability dropdown menu. Now you can either set the values individually or copy the value of the topmost article to the bottom.

Often this option is faster and less error prone than export/import.

setup.plugins.desc.mediafiles.name: Article media files
setup.plugins.desc.mediafiles.text:
With this module, you can upload any media files to any article.
Depending on the file type, a corresponding symbol can also be uploaded.
In the article detail view you will see the download link and the symbol.

setup.plugins.desc.merkliste.name: Watch list
setup.plugins.desc.merkliste.text:
The watchlist function enables you to save items in a list separate from the shopping cart.

The watchlist can be saved in the customer account.

Whole shopping baskets can be stored in the watchlist.

Articles can be placed in the shopping cart directly from the watchlist.

setup.plugins.desc.meta_angaben.name: Metadata for search engines
setup.plugins.desc.meta_angaben.text: This module enables the entry of titles, descriptions, etc., for search engines in articles, sections, additional pages, etc.

setup.plugins.desc.nachweispflicht.name: Proof required?
setup.plugins.desc.nachweispflicht.text:
According to 37b of the Income Tax Act, advertisements must be taxed as a kind of contribution over a certain amount of money.

Since this represents a significant burden for you or the user who uses the shop, the CosmoShop module "Nachweispflicht" provides the logging required by law.

Read here details about the mentioned taxation: http://www.hami-werbeartikel.de/steuern_werbeartikeln

Functionality:
Articles can be marked with the checkbox "Proof required?" correspondingly.
Items marked as such will appear in the shopping cart / checkout area with a text hint.
The buyer can now enter the receivers on the control page, or do so later in his "My account" area.
For this purpose, the shop sends a link in the order confirmation mail, which will be sent directly to the verification form in the "My Account" area.

If the customer hierarchy is used in the shop (special module), the Marketing manager will see if his employees still have to provide the proof who received the goods. There is also a CSV export function.

setup.plugins.desc.newsletter.name: Newsletter module
setup.plugins.desc.newsletter.text:
You can send a newsletter to all newsletter subscribers or all those in the customer management database using this module.
In addition, a coupon module is included, allowing integration of coupon codes in newsletters. The system also offers opt-in, opt-out and subscriber management.

setup.plugins.desc.novalnet.name: Payment module: Novalnet
setup.plugins.desc.novalnet.text: Novalnet payment module for cosmoshop simplifies your daily work by automating the entire payment process from checkout till collection. This module is designed to help you increase your sales by offering various international and local payment methods. The module which is perfectly adjusted to cosmoshop and the top-quality range of services of the payment provider Novalnet.

setup.plugins.desc.open_graph.name: setup.plugins.desc.open_graph
setup.plugins.desc.open_graph.text:
The module makes it possible to provide the various content elements of the shop (image, title, URL, type, location, etc.) with special, standard Open Graph tags. The data standardized in this way can thus be better read out by search engines.

Here you can find more information:

http://ogp.me/

setup.plugins.desc.opentrans.name: openTrans order export
setup.plugins.desc.opentrans.text:
This is a normalized format for order export.
It can be used for transferring orders to Lexware, for example.

setup.plugins.desc.paypalplus.name: Payment module: PayPal PLUS
setup.plugins.desc.paypalplus.text:
PayPal Plus provides an own payment method selection within a widget,in which "PayPal" is displayed at first position with a logo, followed by "Direct Debit" (provided by PayPal) and "Credit Card" (also provided by PayPal). Kindly note that for both of these two options, there is no logo and none can be provided.

Additionally you can have 5 own payment methods to be displayed within the payment selection with either the name of the payment method or a logo that can be uploaded in the payment method administration of the shops. On a click on these payment options, a selection text can be dispayed besides the name/image, that can also be provided in the payment method administration of the shop. The additional payment methods here are the regular active payment methods of the shop in their defined order.

Kindly note that this payment method selection is provided directly by PayPal and is displayed in the shop within an iframe. Therefore you won't be able to style this payment selection by the template administration of the shop.

setup.plugins.desc.pixi.name: Connection to Pixi shipping handling software
setup.plugins.desc.pixi.text: Connection to the order delivery management service "PIXI".

setup.plugins.desc.qenta.name: Payment method: QPAY
setup.plugins.desc.qenta.text:
With Wirecard, you can simultaneously integrate a variety of payment types and additional payment options (such as risk management and fraud prevention).

Wirecard offers the following payment options:

Creditcard Atlernative Payments
Visa SOFORT Transfer
MasterCard PayPal
Maestro (only with 3D Secure) SEPA
American Express EPS
JCB iDeal
Diners Club International Przelewy 24 (P24)
Bancontact/Mister Cash
Guaranteed Invoicing / Direct Debit

Credit cards can also be purchased directly via Wirecard.

HERE you can find more informations about the costs you will expect with the wirecard payment configurator.

setup.plugins.desc.relevanzsuche.name: Relevance search
setup.plugins.desc.relevanzsuche.text: Relevance search provides the option of evaluating items relevant to the shop search in order to create a logical sequence of search results.

setup.plugins.desc.reminder.name: Payment on delivery reminder
setup.plugins.desc.reminder.text:
A reminder for customers who paid using payment on delivery.
After x days an email will be sent, reminding customers to be home with the money, etc.

setup.plugins.desc.responsive.name: Responsive / Mobile
setup.plugins.desc.responsive.text:
With this plugin, the shop is enabled to manage responsive / mobile designs.

The current shop design is called "Bramble".

setup.plugins.desc.rezension.name: Article ratings / reviews
setup.plugins.desc.rezension.text: Indicates our review module, which allows logged-in customers to rate articles (with stars) and leave a comment / review.

setup.plugins.desc.seo.name: SEO optimization
setup.plugins.desc.seo.text:
Here you can add information for articles, categories and additional pages for

  • page title
  • keywords
  • description

setup.plugins.desc.shopgate.name: Shopgate article export
setup.plugins.desc.shopgate.text:
This module generates an export specifically for Shopgate. At Shopgate, your data will be displayed on mobile and even offered via your own Shopping APP.

Note: As of CosmoShop v11, you have your own mobile frontend (responsive).

setup.plugins.desc.shopzilla.name: Shopzilla article export
setup.plugins.desc.shopzilla.text: With this module, article data can be exported in the special Shopzilla (a product portal).

setup.plugins.desc.sucheplus.name: SearchPlus
setup.plugins.desc.sucheplus.text:
This extension of the standard search offers additional possibilities:

- Stop words

- Synonyms

- Phonetic search

- Extended Ajax Search / Suggest

- Setting via search fields

setup.plugins.desc.telecashipg.kurztext:
Start your TeleCash IPG with credit card acceptance with only few steps (page in German):
Click here for registration
setup.plugins.desc.telecashipg.name: Payment module: Telecash IPG

setup.plugins.desc.timeplaner.name: Article Timeplaner
setup.plugins.desc.timeplaner.text: Article start and end dates can be defined to offer articles only in a certain time window

setup.plugins.desc.trichtersuche.name: filter search
setup.plugins.desc.trichtersuche.text:
filter search requires activation of the "Attribute" plug-in

filter search is a module for filtering article lists in the front end

setup.plugins.desc.urloptimierung.name: URL optimization
setup.plugins.desc.urloptimierung.text:
This is a must-have module for any shop operator.
The module shortens URLs that could become cryptic and transforms them into readable form. With the help of the terms in the URL, Google can recognize the page contents better.

Example: You are examining the "Scout" section.
The shortened URL would then be "
www.top-school-bags.com/scout/

Example: You are looking at an article called "Dolphin version".
The shortened URL would then be: www.top-school-bags.com/dolphin-version

URL optimization starts working after about 2-3 clicks in the shop and will then be consistently displayed until the first article is placed into the shopping cart.

setup.plugins.desc.webmasterplan.name: Afilinet webmaster plan
setup.plugins.desc.webmasterplan.text: Is an affiliate system, which can be embedded using this module in order to report sales brought in by Affilinet back to Affilinet.

setup.plugins.desc.welcome_message.name: Welcome message
setup.plugins.desc.welcome_message.text:
Displays an editable message when the shop is called with a specific mobile device.

Browser detection serves as an indicator.

For example, this function can be used to draw attention to the existence of a shopping APPS,

But only if the shop with the identification iphone etc is called.

setup.plugins.desc.widgets.name: Widget for Wordpress
setup.plugins.desc.widgets.text:
With this module, widgets can be generated to integrate shop content (such as product preview, highlight of the week, bestseller, headline preview, or the entire shop).

The encoding nodes are then stored as simple placeholders in e.g. Wordpress embedded. However, these widgets can also be integrated into any other website (similar to the Youtube or Google Maps code snippet).

Here is our plug-in for Wordpress (works with the CosmoShop and with the rental shop):

https://wordpress.org/plugins/mietshop-shopsystem/

setup.plugins.desc.wirecard.name: Payment method: WireCard
setup.plugins.desc.wirecard.text: Please note that credit card payments aren't possible directly via WireCard due to privacy protection reasons. For this, you will need the QPAY interface, which queries credit card data in a way that doesn't compromise data and books the sale internally with WireCard.

setup.plugins.desc.wklayer_crosselling.name: Shopping cart lightbox - cross-selling
setup.plugins.desc.wklayer_crosselling.text:
In the shop settings configuration you can activate the "Shopping cart pop-up / layer" function.

This module makes it possible to additionally display suitable cross-selling articles in this layer. This raises the shopping cart value.

setup.plugins.desc.wunschpreis.name: Target price module
setup.plugins.desc.wunschpreis.text:
Your customers can enter a target price in the article detail view.
You will then be informed per email and in the shop statistics how many customers have done this.

As soon as the article price has been lowered, all customers who have entered a target price will receive an email.

setup.plugins.desc.wunschzettel.name: Wish list
setup.plugins.desc.wunschzettel.text:
This module allows e.g. Family members to meet the different product wishes of another shop user.

To do this, the user creates a wish list and assigns a name (+ password).

Any other user who knows the link, the name and the password can now buy items from it (like a wedding list or birthday). Once the item is purchased, it disappears from the wishlist (so can not be bought twice).

The wish list can be sent by e-mail.

Ideal for B2C shops!

setup.plugins.downloadshop.name: Download shop:
setup.plugins.downloadshop.text:
Function description and instruction for download plug-in

The download module is an extension of the order process which makes it is possible to download files from specially marked articles directly after ordering (and paying), including all security mechanisms and administration functions.
It makes it possible to offer ebooks, MP3 files, etc. for sale on the web.

The following is different compared to a "normal" shop:

1)
the media files plug-in must be activated. It will be expanded, in that it can accept download files such as regular media files (using the download articles checkbox)

2)
the Opentrans interface must be activated. It contains additional database fields for payment status, customer's language, etc., and serves as the base for recognizing which articles (and download files) belong to an order.

3)
in payment methods, an additional "book" checkbox appears. Here you can set whether the payment method should be saved as "directly booked", activating the download right away (such as with Ipayment/telecash payments)

4)
in shipping methods, a dropdown has been added, containing "standard shipping", "download", and "download mixed order" (only if the download plug-in is activated)

5)
in the article form there is a "purely download article" selection. If only "pure download article" are found in the shopping cart, "download" shipping will be offered, otherwise "download mixed order" (or neither, if none of the download articles have been uploaded) will appear.

6)
If download or download mix order is selected as shipping type, the customer will receive a download password in the confirmation email. If the "book" checkbox for the selected payment method is also active, a second email will follow with a deep link to the download area and further instructions. This makes is possible to download files immediately after finishing the order process.

7)
A new menu will appear "Order process"->"Order status", where received orders are listed, including payment status. Payments with activated "book" are listed as "automatically booked", or otherwise as "open". Here you can set the order payment entry to "booked" and, if needed, send an (additional) download email (only for orders that contains a download article)

8)
there is a shop-integrated login form to the download area, reachable only using the download link from the separate email. The download link URL contains an encrypted password, and login is possible only through the combination of this password and the (separately mailed) password from the order confirmation email. An administrable period counted in days remains for the first login, and an administrable period counted in hours remains after the first successful login to download the files. Standard settings: 30 days until first login, and starting from this time, 48 hours to download files

9)
Following a successful download, the corresponding download files will be displayed and can be downloaded.

10)
The original download files will be be trashed using a complicated mechanism and cannot be downloaded without payment at any time.

11)
in addition to the classic media files upload, you can also upload download files using FTP into the (protected) "download" directory, where in addition to the classical media files upload, you will see an optional dropdown with the file name in the upload directory. This way you can assign direct uploads to the articles per FTP.

setup.plugins.downloadshop.xpl_downloads.name: Subject line of download emails
setup.plugins.downloadshop.xpl_downloads.text:
Here you can set the subject line of the special download email containing the link to the login.

You can administer the email text under Order process > Email texts > Download data.

setup.plugins.downloadshop.xpl_downloads.kurztext: in main currency (euro) for purely download orders. Leave blank if you want the standard minimum order value to be used here
setup.plugins.downloadshop.xpl_downloads.name: Download shop: Minimum order value
setup.plugins.downloadshop.xpl_downloads.text: If you are operating a mixed shop with download articles and shipping articles, you can define the minimum order value for download articles separately from the standard minimum value.

setup.plugins.downloadshop.xpl_downloads.kurztext: How many hours the customer has to download the files before the download area becomes invalid (timed from the first successful login to the download area)
setup.plugins.downloadshop.xpl_downloads.name: Download shop: Hours until login is invalidated
setup.plugins.downloadshop.xpl_downloads.text:
How many hours the customer has to download files until the download area becomes invalid (measured from the first successful login to the download area)

The value shouldn't be too high to prevent uncontrolled downloads.

recommended value: 48 hours

setup.plugins.downloadshop.xpl_downloads.kurztext: How many days does the customer have to login before the login expires?
setup.plugins.downloadshop.xpl_downloads.name: Download shop: Days until the login link expires
setup.plugins.downloadshop.xpl_downloads.text:
Here you can set the deadline for the download login link expiration.
Required module: download module (optional)

After the purchase, the customer receives an email containing a link to the download area. This provides access to the purchased file.

The number of days is measured from the sending of the email containing the login data for the download area.

recommended value: max. 30 days

setup.plugins.downloadshop.xpl_downloads.kurztext: if activated, all other shipping methods will be hidden for orders with only download articles
setup.plugins.downloadshop.xpl_downloads.name: only "Download" as shipping when only download articles are in the shopping cart
setup.plugins.downloadshop.xpl_downloads.text:
If only download articles are found in the shopping cart, you can hide all other shipping types (which don't make sense in this case anyway) using this function.
Only the "Download" shipping method is then active.

setup.plugins.econda.name: Econda:
setup.plugins.econda.text:
Optional extra module for evaluation of the shop visitor using an external service provider.
You can find more information at www.econda.com

You will receive a file from Econda (emos.js, emos2.js odg), which you can upload to the shop here.
Starting from this point, the valuation takes place from the Econda interface.

setup.plugins.ekomi.name: eKomi:
setup.plugins.ekomi.text:
Ekomi offers independent customer evaluations by sending emails asking customer to evaluate your shop.
A so-called "widget" is embedded into your shop, which can look like this:

 

 

HERE you can register with eKomi (shop customers get a special discount)

 

Enter files received from eKomi into this administration page and then click on the generator link below the gray box.

 

IMPORTANT:

 

In the eKomi back-end you have to define the widget you want (color, size, etc.) before it will work in your shop.

setup.plugins.ekomi.xpl_ekomi.ekomi_akti.kurztext:
Activates the transfer of the customer's name and email to eKomi.
Trigger emails for evaluation will be sent immediately.
setup.plugins.ekomi.xpl_ekomi.ekomi_akti.name: eKomi - trigger emails requesting evaluation
setup.plugins.ekomi.xpl_ekomi.ekomi_akti.text:
When this function is activated, the name and email address of the customer will be transferred to eKomi after the order is sent out; an email with a message "please evaluate us" will be sent out after a number of days that you can administrate in the eKomi back-end.

Warning!!!
If deactivated, the addresses that have already been transferred will still receive messages in a delayed fashion. Please contact your shop contact person if you would like us to manually delete existing data sets.
Since the names and addresses of the evaluating customers are publicly invisible, a couple of additional evaluations can't hurt...

More information: www.ekomi.de

setup.plugins.ekomi.xpl_ekomi.ekomi_fron.kurztext:
eKomi widget will appear in the left shop navigation.
Warning: the side navigation often is 160px in width, so don't select a widget that's too wide in the eKomi back-end.
setup.plugins.ekomi.xpl_ekomi.ekomi_fron.name: eKomi widget display in the side navigation
setup.plugins.ekomi.xpl_ekomi.ekomi_fron.text:
When activated, the display will appear in the side navigation with the evaluation stars. The eKomi widget will appear there.
For this, you have to have conducted the installation in the eKomi back-end. There, you have to select a widget.

Please note: The side navigation has a width of 160px, so don't pick a widget that's too wide in the ekomi back-end.

setup.plugins.ekomi.xpl_ekomi.ekomi_schn.kurztext: Enter the shop ID received from eKomi
setup.plugins.ekomi.xpl_ekomi.ekomi_schn.name: Interface ID
setup.plugins.ekomi.xpl_ekomi.ekomi_schn.text:
Enter the shop ID received from eKomi

If you're not a customer yet, you can find additional information here:

http://www.ekomi.de/go/anmeldung_direkt.php?lid=33

setup.plugins.ekomi.xpl_ekomi.ekomi_schn.kurztext: (not the login password) can be found in the eKomi administration area.
setup.plugins.ekomi.xpl_ekomi.ekomi_schn.name: Interface password
setup.plugins.ekomi.xpl_ekomi.ekomi_schn.text: The eKomi interface password (not the log-in password) can be found in the eKomi administration area.

setup.plugins.elimbo.name: Elimbo:
setup.plugins.elimbo.text:
Interface to a product portal.
Here you can define whether the interface has to be activated by default (it will then appear under "Promotion tools" > "Elimbo")
In addition, you can enter delivery charges (valid for each and every article), or you can set the checkmark at "Saved delivery charges".
In this case, the delivery charges saved with Elimbo will be applied.

setup.plugins.elimbo.xpl_elimbo.elimbo_a.name: Elimbo product portal interface: Activation
setup.plugins.elimbo.xpl_elimbo.elimbo_a.text:
With this function you can activate CSV Export for Elimbo.
To let active articles be exported, you have to trigger export under Promotion tools->Interfaces->Price portal export->Elimbo.
It's best to do it each time you change an article.

more information & registration at: www.elimbo.de

setup.plugins.elimbo.xpl_elimbo.elimbo_h.anzeigetitel: use delivery charges saved at Elimbo
setup.plugins.elimbo.xpl_elimbo.elimbo_h.kurztext: instead of the entered default delivery charges, the delivery charges saved with Elimbo should be used.
setup.plugins.elimbo.xpl_elimbo.elimbo_h.name: use delivery charges saved in the Elimbo back-end
setup.plugins.elimbo.xpl_elimbo.elimbo_h.text:
You have the option to create your own delivery charge groups in the Elimbo back-end.
If you would like to use these (instead of the default delivery charge), activate this function. The amount listed above will then be ignored.

setup.plugins.elimbo.xpl_elimbo.elimbo_v.kurztext:
Flat-rate delivery charge in Euro.
Leave the field empty if you do not offer a flat-rate delivery charge.
setup.plugins.elimbo.xpl_elimbo.elimbo_v.name: Elimbo: Delivery charge GER
setup.plugins.elimbo.xpl_elimbo.elimbo_v.text: Elimbo cannot simulate your shop's complex delivery charge calculation. Please define a flat-rate value.

setup.plugins.empfehlung.name: Article recommendations:
setup.plugins.empfehlung.text:
On this page you can activate the "Recommend articles" cross-selling module, which displays all articles that were purchased by other visitors along with this article to the shop visitor in the detail view.

You should activate this module and indicate how many articles should be displayed here.
Don't set too high a number to avoid crowding the page with information along with the accessories for the article...

The bar over the displayed article will be labeled with:
Customers who bought this item also looked at:

setup.plugins.empfehlung.xpl_empfehlung..kurztext: General activation of the article recommendation function
setup.plugins.empfehlung.xpl_empfehlung..name: General activation of the article recommendation function
setup.plugins.empfehlung.xpl_empfehlung..text:
Article recommendation is an automated cross-selling function in the article detail.

"Customers who bought this item also bought the following:"

Here you can create links to related articles using individual shop orders.

setup.plugins.empfehlung.xpl_empfehlung..kurztext: Maximum number of articles that are recommended (customers who bought this article also bought the following articles...)
setup.plugins.empfehlung.xpl_empfehlung..name: Number of displayed recommendations
setup.plugins.empfehlung.xpl_empfehlung..text:
The defined value of the immediately displayed recommendations for one article.

We recommend a value between 4 and 8.

setup.plugins.expercash.name: ExperCash
setup.plugins.expercash.text:
Here you can administrate parameters for the "ExperCash" payment interface.

You can find more information at:

www.expercash.com

setup.plugins.expercash.xpl_expercash.ex.name: Payment interface ExperCash pop-up id
setup.plugins.expercash.xpl_expercash.ex.text:
This ID is required to operate the payment interface.

More information: www.expercash.com

setup.plugins.expercash.xpl_expercash.ex.name: Profile ID for Expercash payment interface
setup.plugins.expercash.xpl_expercash.ex.text: This ID is required to operate the Expercash payment interface.

setup.plugins.expercash.xpl_expercash.ex.name: Keys for Expercash payment interface
setup.plugins.expercash.xpl_expercash.ex.text: This value will be required to operate the Expercash payment interface.

setup.plugins.flash_artikelbilder.name: Article images or videos in Flash
setup.plugins.flash_artikelbilder.text: If you would like to upload a Flash animation or an .fla flash film for one of the articles, you can set the default size of the video to ensure that it is well integrated into the article view.

setup.plugins.flash_artikelbilder.xpl_fl.kurztext: in pixels; is used in case no article-specific width is indicated
setup.plugins.flash_artikelbilder.xpl_fl.name: Standard width for Flash graphics
setup.plugins.flash_artikelbilder.xpl_fl.text:
You can upload Flash animations for each article.
These can be product videos in .flv format or other animations in Flash format.
If no specific width is indicated for the file, the shop will use this standard value.

setup.plugins.flash_artikelbilder.xpl_fl.kurztext: in pixels; is used in case no article-specific height is indicated
setup.plugins.flash_artikelbilder.xpl_fl.name: Standard height
setup.plugins.flash_artikelbilder.xpl_fl.text:
You can upload Flash animations for each article.
These can be product videos in .flv format or other animations in Flash format.
If no specific height is indicated for the file, the shop will use this standard value.

setup.plugins.froogle.name: Google Base:
setup.plugins.froogle.text:
optional module - interface to the Google product portal.
The earlier name "Froogle" has now been replaced by "Google product search" or "Productsearch".
Unfortunately, this interface often experiences failures and problems. Google's servers appear to be overloaded, which leads to out-of-date files and portals, etc.
Support speed is also relatively low, and for this reason you often have to guess what has caused an error.


As a rule, you should activate the Froogle interface.
Log on (if you haven't already) using the Froogle button.
Define a file name for the product file (e.g. my_shop.txt)
You save this file on this page in the shop administration.
You should also save your FTP user name and the FTP password (not the merchant center access data! You will receive your FTP data after your login).
According to the latest legislation, delivery charges must also be displayed in product portals. For this reason, in the last line you should define delivery charges and the shipper.
[HERE] HELP for correct way to write and format the delivery charge declaration (Google Help Center)

setup.plugins.froogle.xpl_froogle.froogl.kurztext: Data feed file name (see Google Products set-up)
setup.plugins.froogle.xpl_froogle.froogl.name: Google Products (form: Base) file name
setup.plugins.froogle.xpl_froogle.froogl.text:
Google gets product data automatically from your webspace.
The CSV file, which is created under Promotion Tools->Interfaces->Google Base, is downloaded and read by Google every day.

The file name must be an exact match with the name saved with Google Products.
Pay attention to correct capitalization.
If the file name isn't correct, your file won't be processed and your products won't appear in Google Products.
Don't use a date in the file name.
Please enter only the file name without a path, such as "google_base.txt"

The file is unprotected on your webspace and can be viewed by anyone who knows its name. For this reason, you should use non-standard file names if possible.

setup.plugins.froogle.xpl_froogle.google.kurztext: URL from which the product taxonomy from Google can be downloaded
setup.plugins.froogle.xpl_froogle.google.name: URL for Google taxonomy
setup.plugins.froogle.xpl_froogle.google.text: Google Base categories have to be entered within a given URL scheme. This scheme is provided by Google as a plaintext file. As a rule, this URL shouldn't be changed. If Google published your file somewhere else, you can simply place a new URL here. By default, this URL is set: http://www.google.com/basepages/producttype/taxonomy.de-DE.txt

setup.plugins.google_sitemaps.xpl_google.name: Google Sitemaps automatic generation
setup.plugins.google_sitemaps.xpl_google.text: When enabled, a nightly job generates your sitemaps automated.

setup.plugins.google_sitemaps.xpl_google.name: Google article sitemaps
setup.plugins.google_sitemaps.xpl_google.text: When enabled, all articles will be exported.

setup.plugins.google_sitemaps.xpl_google.name: Google Article Image Sitemaps
setup.plugins.google_sitemaps.xpl_google.text: When enabled, all article images will be exported too.

setup.plugins.google_sitemaps.xpl_google.name: Google category sitemaps
setup.plugins.google_sitemaps.xpl_google.text: When enabled, all categories will be exported too.

setup.plugins.google_sitemaps.xpl_google.name: Google category image sitemaps
setup.plugins.google_sitemaps.xpl_google.text: When enabled, all category images will be exported.

setup.plugins.google_sitemaps.xpl_google.name: Service page sitemaps
setup.plugins.google_sitemaps.xpl_google.text: When enabled, all service pages will be exported too.

setup.plugins.gutschein.name: Coupons:
setup.plugins.gutschein.text:
either automatically issues coupons or enables manual coupon creation. In addition, you can send coupons in newsletters.

Activate creation of automatic order bonuses on this page.
This way every customer will receive a coupon (in proportion to the current shopping cart value). The percent used to calculate the amount can be entered in the next line.
To ensure that coupons don't end up costing you money, you can set the maximum coupon value, minimum shopping cart value and coupon expiration date.

Rebate coupons: Should the coupon with percent values be limited for use only with certain articles? These will be shown when the coupon is generated. This feature may easily lead to accidental "empty" coupons and should only be activated if you really need it.

Number in list: Defines the number of coupons displayed on each page in the coupon management (menu "Promotion Tools">"Coupons")

Sales tax rate for coupons
Sales tax calculation unfortunately also applies to coupons.
Indicate here which sales tax rate should be applied.
You can either set a fixed value or you can check the box (next line), which will apply the highest sales tax rate found in the shopping cart.

Sales tax rate depends on shopping cart:
This applies the highest sales tax rate found among the items in the shopping cart.

setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.Fe.kurztext: The first part of the error report in the case of insufficient minimum order value for the coupon.
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.Fe.name: Error; coupon minimum order value not reached (part 1)
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.Fe.text: The first part of the error report in the case of insufficient minimum order value for the coupon.

setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.Fe.kurztext: Part 2 of the error report for coupon minimum order value.
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.Fe.name: Error; coupon minimum order value not reached (part 2)
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.Fe.text: Part 2 of the error report for not reached coupon minimum order value.

setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.Fe.kurztext: used in order step 1 with wrong code entry.
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.Fe.name: Error; wrong coupon code
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.Fe.text: If the customer used an incorrect or non-existent coupon code, the error message that you can edit here appears.

setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.Fe.name: Error; coupon already used
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.Fe.text: The error message that you can administrate here is used if a coupon that has already been redeemed is used again.

setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.Fe.name: Error; product groups coupon
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.Fe.text: The shop offers the function to allow coupons for only certain product groups. It may be difficult for customers to grasp this. The error message that you can edit here can help in such a case.

setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.kurztext: Every customer receives a coupon for a certain percentage of the total order. This encourage customer loyalty. For further settings see below:
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.name: Automatic order bonus
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.text:
This feature is highly recommended.
You reward each customer for a purchase AND create an incentive for repeat visits to your shop. You should also activate coupon reminders, which increase the probability of returning visitors.

The automatic order bonus is given only once for each order.
Likewise, only ONE coupon can be redeemed per order.

setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.kurztext: if you selected "fixed expiration date" above.
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.name: expiration date for bonus coupons
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.text:
If the automatic bonus coupon should expire on a certain date, enter the date here.
The "Coupon expiration date" menu point should be defined as "fixed expiration date".

You should also activate the coupon reminder (top menu field) in addition to this function.

setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.kurztext: (main currency). Upper limit on the value of the bonus coupon value.
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.name: max. bonus coupon amount
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.text: You can "cap" the bonus coupon value by entering a maximum value here.

setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.anzeigetitel: Order bonus starting at a minimum value
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.kurztext: (main currency). An order bonus coupon will be automatically generated starting at this minimum order value.
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.name: Order bonus starting at a minimum value
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.text:
If you would like to use the automatic order bonus in a smart way, we recommend setting a certain minimum order value for it.
Otherwise, a customer could get a coupon for 0.04 euros.

setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.kurztext: (main currency). Only after reaching this order value will it be possible to redeem a coupon in the checkout area.
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.name: Minimum value for redeeming a bonus coupon
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.text:
To make sure that the bonus coupons make business sense, you can link a minimum sales threshold to it.

The bonus coupon will then be redeemable only when a customer has reached a certain value (shopping cart total, without payment fees and delivery charges).

setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.kurztext: %. (=amount of the bonus coupon in percent of the order sum)
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.name: Order bonus amount
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.text: Here you can define how much %of the shopping cart value (without payment fees and delivery charges) you would like to issue the customer as a coupon.

setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.kurztext: days following the order that the coupon expires. (used when you have selected "flexible expiration date" above).
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.name: flexible expiration date
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.text:
If you have selected "flexible expiration date" in the above settings, the automatic order bonus coupons expire always after the number of days set here.
You should also activate the coupon reminder in addition to this function (top menu field).

setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.name: set the order bonus coupon expiration
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.be.text:
You can link all order bonus coupons either with a fixed "deadline" (such as until 31.12.) or, for example, let all coupons expire 30 days after issue.

Please take note of legal regulations.
Only bonus coupons may have an expiration date.
Value coupons are treated differently.

setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.gu.name: Voucher Label
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.gu.text: This label will be set for voucher rows in the cart and be used if not overwritten by a label provided by a template. This value will be used primarily in third party interfaces that submit the cart content like in some payment modules or ERPs.

setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.gu.kurztext: automatically generated coupon codes are created based on this pattern. Every X is replaced with a random character. For example: XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.gu.name: Coupon pattern
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.gu.text:
You can define the complexity of a coupon code here.
It is recommended not to set patterns that are too simple, since this increases the probability of finding a coupon by trial and error.

setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.gu.kurztext: Number of lines that should appear in the coupon management per page.
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.gu.name: Browse factor for coupon management
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.gu.text:
Relates to the Promotion Tools > Coupons > Manage area.
There you will find all used coupon codes.
To make sure that not too many appear on each page, you can set the browse factor here and define how many coupons should be shown per page.

setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.gu.kurztext: Only when using % coupons: Should article rebate groups be limited? These will then be shown when the coupon is generated. This feature can, however, easily lead to unusable coupons and should be activated only if you really need it.
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.gu.name: Limitation of % coupons to article rebate groups
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.gu.text:
Only usable when using percent coupons.
In this context, article rebate group limitations can be defined.
A % coupon can then be redeemed for "rebate items" article group.
The possible groups will then be displayed when the coupon is generated (Promotion Tools > Coupons > Edit).

Note!
This feature can easily lead to unusable coupons and should only be activated if you really need it.
If non-rebate articles are found in the shopping cart, the coupon won't be redeemable and the customer will go to support.

setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.gu.kurztext: Days before each coupon expires, the customer will receive a reminder email. If you leave the field empty or set it to 0, the customer won't receive a reminder.
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.gu.name: Automatic coupon reminders per email
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.gu.text:
This "marketing function" has a very big effect.
If your coupons have an expiration date (including automatic order bonus as well as fixed value coupons, promotional coupons, etc.), then your customers can be automatically reminded x days before their expiration to redeem them "on time".
Most customers can't bear to let the rebate go to waste and will visit the shop. Goal reached!

setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.mw.kurztext: for set taxation of the coupons at this rate. You can also activate the automatic option (next menu point).
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.mw.name: Sales tax rate for coupons
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.mw.text: If you have selected a value here (such as 19%) and HAVEN'T set a checkmark in the next menu, the coupon found in the shopping cart will be taxed at 19%.

setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.mw.kurztext: set sales tax rate for coupon taxation automatically to the highest sales tax rate of all articles found in the shopping cart.
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.mw.name: apply highest sales tax rate
setup.plugins.gutschein.xpl_gutschein.mw.text: If you activate this function, coupon taxation will take place with the highest sales tax rate of all articles found in the shopping cart.

setup.plugins.heidelpay.xpl_heidelpay.he.name: Parameter "CHANNEL"
setup.plugins.heidelpay.xpl_heidelpay.he.text: This parameter is offered by Heidelpay; please enter information here so that the interface can function.

setup.plugins.heidelpay.xpl_heidelpay.he.kurztext: This parameter is offered to you by Heidelpay
setup.plugins.heidelpay.xpl_heidelpay.he.name: Gateway URL (Live)

setup.plugins.heidelpay.xpl_heidelpay.he.kurztext: This parameter is offered to you by Heidelpay
setup.plugins.heidelpay.xpl_heidelpay.he.name: Gateway URL (Test)

setup.plugins.heidelpay.xpl_heidelpay.he.kurztext: Which credit cards should be offered as options for the buyer?
setup.plugins.heidelpay.xpl_heidelpay.he.name: Offer credit cards as payment options in the shop
setup.plugins.heidelpay.xpl_heidelpay.he.text:
All credit cards checked off here will be available as payment methods in the checkout area.
Please note that you have to sign contracts with the corresponding acquirers in order to offer these credit card types.
There are also group contracts that you can sign with a central partner that offer contracts with various credit card providers.

More information at: http://www.heidelpay.de/en/payment/

setup.plugins.heidelpay.xpl_heidelpay.he.name: Parameter "LOGIN"
setup.plugins.heidelpay.xpl_heidelpay.he.text: This parameter is offered by Heidelpay; please enter information here so that the interface can function.

setup.plugins.heidelpay.xpl_heidelpay.he.name: Mode
setup.plugins.heidelpay.xpl_heidelpay.he.text: Here you can activate the interface's Live Mode or one of the two Test Modes. For both of the test modes, the 'Gateway URL (test)' below is used, for the live mode, the "Gateway URL (live)'.

setup.plugins.heidelpay.xpl_heidelpay.he.name: Parameter "PWD"
setup.plugins.heidelpay.xpl_heidelpay.he.text: This parameter is offered by Heidelpay; please enter information here so that the interface can function.

setup.plugins.heidelpay.xpl_heidelpay.he.name: Parameter "SENDER"
setup.plugins.heidelpay.xpl_heidelpay.he.text: This parameter is offered by Heidelpay; please enter information here so that the interface can function.

setup.plugins.heidelpay.xpl_heidelpay.he.kurztext: Kindly note that your Payment Service Provider (PSP) has to support the selected method. Please contact your PSP to find out, from when respectively until when the methods will be supported.
setup.plugins.heidelpay.xpl_heidelpay.he.name: Show SEPA fields in the bank account form
setup.plugins.heidelpay.xpl_heidelpay.he.text:
You can choose here, if you want to show whether the SEPA fields (BIC/IBAN) or the classic Account Number / BIN) within the bank account form. You can also choose to show both variants and let your customer decide for himself.

Kindly note that your Payment Service Provider (PSP) has to support the selected method. Please contact your PSP to find out, from when respectively until when the methods will be supported.

setup.plugins.heidelpay.xpl_heidelpay.he.kurztext: Should credit card bookings take place immediately, together with order shipping, or later during merchandise management, for example?
setup.plugins.heidelpay.xpl_heidelpay.he.name: Booking / preAuth?
setup.plugins.heidelpay.xpl_heidelpay.he.text:
Here you can decide whether you would like to book the amount from the customer's credit card right away, or if want to only "preauthorize" (preAuth process) the card. In this case, your shipping and handling software or merchandise manager must be capable of booking the preauthorized amount at the time of delivery.

Either way, you won't receive your money directly from the person ordering, but via the interface operator/payment provider (in this case, Heidelpay).

setup.plugins.ipayment.name: iPayment:
setup.plugins.ipayment.text:
enables payment by bank transfer, credit card and other payment methods credited to iPayment.
Processed payments are automatically booked to your account via these "online clearing" interfaces. The order can be shipped immediately after receiving such a confirmation, as the payment process has already taken place (in contrast to pre-payment, for example).
Registration for iPayment takes place on the 1&1 website:
www.ipayment.de

You should generally activate this interface on this page.
Fill the described parameters found in the iPayment administration.
In addition you can select the used currency.

Set a checkmark next to the corresponding payment methods in the "Ordering system">"Order process">"Payment methods" menu in order to let these go through iPayment.
Payment data in the order process/checkout area will then be encrypted and transferred to iPayment unnoticed by the customer.
If an "OK" code is returned, the order will be shipped or confirmed.
If a "NOT OK" code returns, an error report appears and the order won't be shipped. Aktivieren Sie diese Schnittstelle auf dieser Seite grundsätzlich.Hinterlegen Sie dann die beschriebenen Parameter, welche Sie in der ipayment Administration vorfinden.Zudem kann hier die verwendete Währung festgelegt werden.Im Menüpunkt "Bestellablauf"->"Bestellvorgang"->"Zahlarten" setzen Sie bei den entsprechenden Zahlarten dann ein Häkchen, um diese über iPayment laufen zu lassen. Dann werden die Zahlungsdaten im Bestellvorgang / Kassenbereich verschlüsselt und unmerklich für den Besteller im Hintergrund der Seite an iPayment übertragen.Kommt ein "OK" Code zurück, wird die Bestellung abgeschickt, bzw. Bestätigt.Kommt ein "NICHT OK" Code zurück, erscheint eine Fehlermeldung und die Bestellung kann nicht abgeschickt werden.

setup.plugins.ipayment.xpl_ipayment.ipay.name: Parameter "Account ID"
setup.plugins.ipayment.xpl_ipayment.ipay.text: This parameter is provided to you by iPayment. Please enter information here so that the payment interface can function.

setup.plugins.ipayment.xpl_ipayment.ipay.kurztext: Currency in which payments should be processed. All recognized three-letter ISO currency codes are allowed. Standard: EUR
setup.plugins.ipayment.xpl_ipayment.ipay.name: Currency (ISO code)
setup.plugins.ipayment.xpl_ipayment.ipay.text: Currency in which payments should be processed. All recognized three-letter ISO currency codes are allowed. Standard: EUR

setup.plugins.ipayment.xpl_ipayment.ipay.name: Activation of the iPayment interface
setup.plugins.ipayment.xpl_ipayment.ipay.text:
If a checkmark is set, the interface is generally activated.
Additional settings must be made in the "Ordering system > Order process > Payment methods.

setup.plugins.ipayment.xpl_ipayment.ipay.name: "Transaction User Password"
setup.plugins.ipayment.xpl_ipayment.ipay.text:
This parameter is provided to you by iPayment. Please enter information here so that the payment interface can function.

Every application has a transaction user password

setup.plugins.ipayment.xpl_ipayment.ipay.kurztext: when activated, the amount is only reserved on the credit card and not booked immediately. The booking has to be made by the merchandise manager during shipping or manually. Debit payments will be booked immediately independent of this setting.
setup.plugins.ipayment.xpl_ipayment.ipay.name: only preauthorization, no direct booking
setup.plugins.ipayment.xpl_ipayment.ipay.text:
If this function is activated, the amount will be reserved on the credit card on not booked immediately when the order is sent off.
Booking must be made by the merchandise manager when the order is shipped or manually.

Note!
Debit payments will be booked immediately independently of this setting.

setup.plugins.ipayment.xpl_ipayment.ipay.kurztext: secret character string, as given in the iPayment application ("Secret")
setup.plugins.ipayment.xpl_ipayment.ipay.name: Parameter "Security key"
setup.plugins.ipayment.xpl_ipayment.ipay.text: You will find this parameter in your iPayment back-end under "Secret"; you should enter it here so that the payment interface can function.

setup.plugins.ipayment.xpl_ipayment.ipay.kurztext: Kindly note that your Payment Service Provider (PSP) has to support the selected method. Please contact your PSP to find out, from when respectively until when the methods will be supported.
setup.plugins.ipayment.xpl_ipayment.ipay.name: Show SEPA fields in the bank account form
setup.plugins.ipayment.xpl_ipayment.ipay.text:
You can choose here, if you want to show whether the SEPA fields (BIC/IBAN) or the classic Account Number / BIN) within the bank account form. You can also choose to show both variants and let your customer decide for himself.

Kindly note that your Payment Service Provider (PSP) has to support the selected method. Please contact your PSP to find out, from when respectively until when the methods will be supported.

setup.plugins.ipayment.xpl_ipayment.ipay.kurztext:
is provided by iPayment.
An account can create and use multiple applications/users for various shops in the iPayment configuration menu, for example. You can also activate various payment methods for each application.
setup.plugins.ipayment.xpl_ipayment.ipay.name: Parameter "USER ID"
setup.plugins.ipayment.xpl_ipayment.ipay.text:
This parameter is offered in iPayments; please fill it in so that the payment interface can function.

An account can create and use multiple applications/users for various shops in the iPayment configuration menu, for example. You can also activate various payment methods for each application.

setup.plugins.klarna.xpl_klarna.klarna_c.anzeigetitel: Error text: Klarna checkbox for installment payment
setup.plugins.klarna.xpl_klarna.klarna_c.name: Error text: Klarna checkbox for installment payment
setup.plugins.klarna.xpl_klarna.klarna_c.text: This message appears in the order process if the customer didn't agree to the terms of Klarna installment payments.

setup.plugins.klarna.xpl_klarna.klarna_c.anzeigetitel: Error text: Klarna checkbox for invoice
setup.plugins.klarna.xpl_klarna.klarna_c.name: Error text: Klarna checkbox for invoice
setup.plugins.klarna.xpl_klarna.klarna_c.text: This message will appear if the customer has not agreed to the Klarna contract terms and conditions on the invoice in the order process.

setup.plugins.klarna.xpl_klarna.klarna_e.name: E-shop ID Klarna
setup.plugins.klarna.xpl_klarna.klarna_e.text: You can receive the Klarna e-shop ID from Klarna. You can apply for a merchant account here .

setup.plugins.klarna.xpl_klarna.klarna_g.name: Maximum merchandise value for display of Klarna installment options.
setup.plugins.klarna.xpl_klarna.klarna_g.text:
Here you can set the maximum article value for which installments will be displayed in the front end. Only the main price is considered in the calculation. Additional costs for various versions are not included.

Please also note the Klarna specifications.

setup.plugins.klarna.xpl_klarna.klarna_k.name: smallest merchandise value for Klarna installment option display
setup.plugins.klarna.xpl_klarna.klarna_k.text:
In the article, installment amounts for financing will be displayed. Here you can define the starting article value from which installments will be displayed. Only the main article price is considered. Additional costs of alternative versions won't be examined.

Please also note the Klarna specifications.

setup.plugins.klarna.xpl_klarna.klarna_l.anzeigetitel: Error text: no alternate delivery address, Klarna
setup.plugins.klarna.xpl_klarna.klarna_l.name: Error text: no alternate delivery address, Klarna
setup.plugins.klarna.xpl_klarna.klarna_l.text: Klarna doesn't allow alternate delivery addresses. If a customer has entered a different delivery address, this message will appear in the order process.

setup.plugins.klarna.xpl_klarna.klarna_r.name: Display monthly installments
setup.plugins.klarna.xpl_klarna.klarna_r.text: If activated, the lowest possible monthly rates will be calculated for various prices in your shop. Note: if a rate of 0.00 is calculated, please check whether the configuration for Klarna installment payments has been set by Klarna and imported (see above).

setup.plugins.klarna.xpl_klarna.klarna_s.name: secret key, Klarna
setup.plugins.klarna.xpl_klarna.klarna_s.text: You will receive the secret key from Klarna. You can register a merchant account here .

setup.plugins.klarna.xpl_klarna.klarna_t.name: Klarna test mode
setup.plugins.klarna.xpl_klarna.klarna_t.text: With activated test mode you can test the interface without having to functionally exchange data (see below). Invoices generated in activated test mode will be clearly marked as a test invoice by Klarna.

setup.plugins.lexikon.name: Lexicon:
setup.plugins.lexikon.text:
optional additional mode

here you will find settings options:

in the "intermediate stage in keyword list" you can influence the front-end display. If, for example, value 5 is set, entries with description will be displayed for the total listing of each letter if there is a maximum of 5 entries. Only keywords will be listed if there are more than 5 entries. Clicking on each word will provide a description of it.

setup.plugins.lexikon.xpl_lexikon.lexiko.name: Activate lexicon function in general
setup.plugins.lexikon.xpl_lexikon.lexiko.text:
If activated here, you still have to define terms that you want to add explanations for under Data > Lexicon.
These terms will then be underlined in the shop and will appear with a tooltip (containing the explanation).

(HTML color code, see color table below). 
Color of the currently active first letter in the lexicon view

setup.plugins.lexikon.xpl_lexikon.lexiko.text: (HTML color code, see color table below). Color of the first letter in the lexicon view if an entry for this letter has been found.

setup.plugins.lexikon.xpl_lexikon.lexiko.kurztext: (in px.). Letter index in the lexicon view. Active letter.
setup.plugins.lexikon.xpl_lexikon.lexiko.name: Index font size (active)
setup.plugins.lexikon.xpl_lexikon.lexiko.text:
The general lexicon view contains all letters at the top in a line.
The letter currently active will have this font size.
To help the visitor see which letter he is currently in, the ACTIVE letter is displayed larger.

setup.plugins.lexikon.xpl_lexikon.lexiko.kurztext: (in px). Letter index of the lexicon general view.
setup.plugins.lexikon.xpl_lexikon.lexiko.name: Index font size (inactive)

All inactive letters have this font size.
To help the visitor recognize which letter he is currently in, the ACTIVE letter should appear bigger (see next menu field).

setup.plugins.lexikon.xpl_lexikon.lexiko.kurztext:
Search mode for finding lexicon terms. 
Example: The term "Copy" has been entered, in the running text the following terms appear: "Copy", "Copyright" and "Microscopy". Search for the whole word finds just "Copy", search for the beginning of the word additionally finds "Copyright", search for word parts finds all three terms, since each contains "copy".
setup.plugins.lexikon.xpl_lexikon.lexiko.name: Search mode
setup.plugins.lexikon.xpl_lexikon.lexiko.text:
Search mode for term linking.
Example for the term "Copy" has been entered and in the running text the following terms appear: "Copy", "Copyright" and "Microscopy". Search for the whole word finds just "Copy", search for the beginning of the word additionally finds "Copyright", search for word parts finds all three terms, since each contains "copy".
