setup.plugins.liveshopping.xpl_liveshopp.name: general activation of the live shopping function
setup.plugins.liveshopping.xpl_liveshopp.text: Articles can be listed with a different price and description text for a certain period of time on the start page and an additional page.

setup.plugins.liveshopping.xpl_liveshopp.anzeigetitel: Number of articles on the start page
setup.plugins.liveshopping.xpl_liveshopp.name: Number of articles on the start page
setup.plugins.liveshopping.xpl_liveshopp.text: If a value is entered here, the number of articles on the start page will be limited. If the value is 0, or nothing is entered, all articles will be listed. Articles will be sorted according to the start date in reverse order.

setup.plugins.liveshopping.xpl_liveshopp.anzeigetitel: Number of articles on additional page
setup.plugins.liveshopping.xpl_liveshopp.name: Number of articles on additional page
setup.plugins.liveshopping.xpl_liveshopp.text:
If a value is entered here, the number of articles appearing on the additional page will be limited. On the additional page all articles will be listed according to start date in reverse order.

The value in this field should definitely be higher than the value in the "Articles on the start page" field.

setup.plugins.liveshopping.xpl_liveshopp.kurztext: activates the Live Shopping function on the article detail page
setup.plugins.liveshopping.xpl_liveshopp.name: activates the Live Shopping function on the article detail page
setup.plugins.liveshopping.xpl_liveshopp.text: Display the Live Shopping function on the article detail page via the shopping cart block.

setup.plugins.liveshopping.xpl_liveshopp.kurztext: activates the Live Shopping function on the start page
setup.plugins.liveshopping.xpl_liveshopp.name: Live Shopping function activation on the start page
setup.plugins.liveshopping.xpl_liveshopp.text: Display Live Shopping function on the start page

setup.plugins.liveshopping.xpl_liveshopp.name: Link to the "Live shopping" additional page
setup.plugins.liveshopping.xpl_liveshopp.text:
If the number of Live Shopping articles on the start page is limited, but more Live Shopping articles are available, a link will appear at the end of the listings to an additional page where all Live Shopping articles appear (including the ones on the start page).

Activate this check box only if there are more Live Shopping articles available than what you would like to display on your start page.

setup.plugins.loginpage.xpl_loginpage.lo.anzeigetitel: Enables the login in front of the Shop. Please read the help (i).
setup.plugins.loginpage.xpl_loginpage.lo.name: Beforehand Login
setup.plugins.loginpage.xpl_loginpage.lo.text:
Under Data-> Customer-> Settings -> "Link to registration", you can set whether a link to the registration should be displayed on the login page. Then anyone can register. There is the option of manually checking and unlocking the registration.

Note:
The general customer settings: "manual release", "order only after login", "prices only visible after login" and "closed B2B shop" are automatically activated by the system when the front page is activated.

The difference between this function (front page) and the function "Closed B2B Shop" is that the shop side is not visible at all. Only after the login a user reaches the shop. Search engine spiders are thus also completely excluded.
In the closed B2B shop, the shop itself can be called up, you can see the header, menu, footer and so on. However, the login is displayed on the start page and every link (no matter whether on category, article or additional page) lands on the homepage at login.
Via this variant one can give the (potential) customers / dealers at least a rough taste, if desired.

setup.plugins.mediafinanz.name: Mediafinanz:
setup.plugins.mediafinanz.text:
enables transfer of claims to an electronic collection agency.

You should generally activate the interface on this page.
Fill out the described parameters, which you will receive directly from Mediafinanz.

Please also note the "Ordering system"->"Mediafinanz" menu field. There you will find a list of all orders and the orders transferred to Mediafinanz, including reminder and payment status.

setup.plugins.mediafinanz.xpl_mediafinan.kurztext: General activation of the Mediafinanz interface
setup.plugins.mediafinanz.xpl_mediafinan.name: General activation of the Mediafinanz interface
setup.plugins.mediafinanz.xpl_mediafinan.text:
Please note that you can manage and forward claims in the "Ordering system > Mediafinanz" area.

You can find more information at: http://www.mediafinanz.de/

setup.plugins.mediafinanz.xpl_mediafinan.name: Parameter "Partner ID"
setup.plugins.mediafinanz.xpl_mediafinan.text: This parameter will be supplied to you by Mediafinanz. Please fill it out to enable this function to work.

setup.plugins.mediafinanz.xpl_mediafinan.name: Parameter "Client ID"
setup.plugins.mediafinanz.xpl_mediafinan.text: This parameter will be supplied to you by Mediafinanz. Please fill it out to enable this function to work.

setup.plugins.mediafinanz.xpl_mediafinan.text: This parameter will be supplied to you by Mediafinanz. Please fill it out to enable this function to work.

setup.plugins.merkliste.name: Watch list:
setup.plugins.merkliste.text:
The Watch List is included by default starting from Version 10.1 and enables your shop visitors to save articles without placing them directly into the shopping cart.
This gives some customers a feeling of security, because they presume a pressure to purchase when they execute the "Place in shopping cart" action, or lose the overview.
The tool enables them to send a watch list to friends in order to get a second opinion.
Articles can be placed into the shopping cart from the watch list, just as articles in the cart can be transferred into the watch list.

setup.plugins.merkliste.xpl_merkliste.ml.name: general watch list activation
setup.plugins.merkliste.xpl_merkliste.ml.text:
The watch list is a second shopping cart where articles can be placed.
However, they don't end up in the checkout area, but are only "watched".
A list can be saved indefinitely, individual or all articles can be sent to the shopping cart and the list can be emailed.

setup.plugins.merkliste.xpl_merkliste.ml.kurztext: applies only to watch lists that aren't assigned to a customer login. Indicates how many days a watch list is saved for (counting from the last shop visit)
setup.plugins.merkliste.xpl_merkliste.ml.name: Watch list lifespan
setup.plugins.merkliste.xpl_merkliste.ml.text:
This setting applies only to watch lists that aren't associated with a customer login.
If a shop visitor is logged in and then placed the articles on a watch list, this list will remain permanently saved.
If a customer who is not logged in places an article into the shopping cart and doesn't log in (or has no login at all), the watch list will expire in x days (settings can be changed here).
The list is saved using cookies.
If the customer erases his cookies, the watch list will no longer be available.

setup.plugins.merkliste.xpl_merkliste.ml.anzeigetitel: Thumbnails in the watch list email.
setup.plugins.merkliste.xpl_merkliste.ml.kurztext: show thumbnails in the watch list mail? Currently available images from the website will be referenced, no images will be actually emailed.
setup.plugins.merkliste.xpl_merkliste.ml.name: Thumbnails in the watch list email.
setup.plugins.merkliste.xpl_merkliste.ml.text:
If you activate this function, small thumbnails will appear when you send a watch list email to yourself.
Images currently available on your website will be referenced, no images are directly emailed (this would cause problems, since some email providers classify such emails as spam, and some recipients won't open such emails).

Warning!
If you change or delete preview images in the shop, these will not appear in OLD wish list mails (because the images are no longer available at the referenced location).

setup.plugins.newsletter.name: Newsletter:
setup.plugins.newsletter.text:
Here you can determine whether the newsletter subscription form is displayed in the shop or not. In either case, you will still be able to access previous subscribers and send out the newsletter.
Here you can define the newsletter sender (this can also be an email address that does not yet exist).
If the form for subscribing to the newsletter is not to be displayed directly in the right shop bar (standard setting), but on a separate page, please set the appropriate check box.
On a separate page you can then request many additional parameters from your shop visitors.
This can include postal address, department, telephone, etc.
In addition, you can indicate which fields should be required.

setup.plugins.newsletter.xpl_newsletter..name: Newsletter sender
setup.plugins.newsletter.xpl_newsletter..text: Defines from which email address the newsletter will be sent by default.

setup.plugins.newsletter.xpl_newsletter..kurztext: dient als Schutz vor Spamangriffen ber die Newsletter an-/abmeldung.
setup.plugins.newsletter.xpl_newsletter..name: Captcha
setup.plugins.newsletter.xpl_newsletter..text:
Über einen Captcha kann verhindert werden, dass das Formular des Newsletters zum Spam-Mailversand missbraucht wird.
Falls Sie Google reCAPTCHA aktiviert haben, wird dieser hier angezeigt.
Falls nicht, wird eine Captcha-Grafik (Folge von Zahlen und Buchstaben) angezeigt.

Die Aktiverung ist unbedingt zu empfehlen.

Worterklärung: CAPTCHA ist ein Akronym für Completely Automated Public Turing test to tell Computers and Humans Apart. Wörtlich übersetzt bedeutet das „Vollautomatischer öffentlicher Turing-Test zur Unterscheidung von Computern und Menschen“.

setup.plugins.newsletter.xpl_newsletter..kurztext: Here you can define which fields should be displayed in the newsletter form.
setup.plugins.newsletter.xpl_newsletter..name: Newsletter form fields
setup.plugins.newsletter.xpl_newsletter..text:
The function for newsletter subscription is also reachable via the service area (Service menu).
Here you can define which fields you would like to include.
In addition you can also offer the visitors the option of entering information in the shop checkout area (top menu field).

All subscription options take place through the predefined opt-IN process (the customer will receive an email with a confirmation link which must be clicked to confirm interest in the newsletter).

setup.plugins.newsletter.xpl_newsletter..kurztext: Here you can determine whether the "Subscribe to newsletter" button should appear in the address entry field of the checkout area. Independently of what you select, you can still access newsletter management in the administrator area.
setup.plugins.newsletter.xpl_newsletter..name: Show newsletter subscription?
setup.plugins.newsletter.xpl_newsletter..text:
Here you can determine whether the "Subscribe to newsletter" button should appear in the address entry field of the checkout area.
According to current regulations, the checkbox may NOT be checked-off by default.
A disclaimer must appear next to it stating that the customer may unsubscribe at any time.
You can manage the texts under:
Design/Layout > Template > Management > Shop page displays > Order step 3

Independently of what you select, you can still access newsletter management in the administrator area (Promotion tools > Newsletter).

setup.plugins.newsletter.xpl_newsletter..kurztext: Which of the fields above should be required?
setup.plugins.newsletter.xpl_newsletter..name: Required fields in newsletter form
setup.plugins.newsletter.xpl_newsletter..text:
You can also reach the newsletter subscription function through the service area (Service menu).
Here you can define which fields are required.
From experience we can inform you that making too many fields required will lead to high termination rates.
You will get more subscribers if you place fewer fields and especially fewer required fields in your newsletter form.

You can also offer a simple newsletter subscription using email address and customer name in the checkout area using the uppermost menu field.

All subscription options take place via the opt-IN process (where the customer will receive a confirmation email with a link which must be clicked to confirm the newsletter subscription).

setup.plugins.opentrans.name: OpenTrans:
setup.plugins.opentrans.text:
Order export format openTRANS serves to export settings to external systems such as Lexware.

It is recommended that you activate this interface by default.
Define whether the bank data entered by the customer should be transferred via Opentrans.
If you have an online clearing interface (such as Telecash), this setting makes no sense, since data goes directly to Telecash and therefore isn't available on the server.
Display of article, shipping, and payment prices as net or gross?
UTF-8/UNI code
if activated, the XML exports will be made in UTF-8 (unicode), otherwise in ISO-8859-1 (iso-latin-1, the default character set). A false setting here will result in incorrect umlaut display. The necessary setting is set by the recipient program (WaWi). Please don't activate for Lexware exports.

setup.plugins.opentrans.xpl_opentrans.op.kurztext: with activation, orders will be saved for later export via the openTRANS interface.
setup.plugins.opentrans.xpl_opentrans.op.name: openTRANS interface order export activation
setup.plugins.opentrans.xpl_opentrans.op.text:
openTRANS is a standardized format for order transmission.
You can learn more at:
http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/OpenTRANS

Here you can activate the general option to later export your orders in this special XML format in the "Promotion Tools > openTRANS export" menu.
After activation, all orders will be saved in a database and offered as compressed zip files in case of disruption of openTrans export.

You can use the order export in order to import files into your merchandising system (such as Lexware).

setup.plugins.opentrans.xpl_opentrans.op.kurztext: when activated, the openTRANS interface compiles the debit transaction data entered during the order process. This option shouldn't be activated if an external payment module is used and the bank data isn't needed (please respect data privacy).
setup.plugins.opentrans.xpl_opentrans.op.name: Export bank data too?
setup.plugins.opentrans.xpl_opentrans.op.text:
When activated, the openTRANS interface compiles the debit transaction data entered during the order process.
Credit card information will not be saved at any point.
This option shouldn't be activated if an external payment module is used and the bank data isn't needed (please respect data privacy).

setup.plugins.opentrans.xpl_opentrans.op.kurztext: should delivery charges and payment fees be calculated as net or gross? Article prices are generally listed gross as well as net.
setup.plugins.opentrans.xpl_opentrans.op.name: Price display
setup.plugins.opentrans.xpl_opentrans.op.text: should delivery charges and payment fees be calculated as net or gross? Article prices are generally listed gross as well as net.

setup.plugins.opentrans.xpl_opentrans.op.kurztext: when activated, XML exports are made in UTF-8 (unicode), otherwise in ISO-8859-1 (iso-latin-1, the normal character set). Incorrect settings here can result in umlauts being displayed incorrectly. The necessary settings are provided by the recipient program (WaWi). Please don't activate for Lexware exports.

setup.plugins.payone.xpl_payone.payone_n.text:
If inactive, all amounts for all PAYONE payment methods will be booked directly during order shipping.

When active, for all PAYONE payments made via credit card, debit transfer and e-wallet, the amounts will be only reserved, while for all other PAYONE payment methods, the amounts will be directly booked as before.

Reserved amounts will be booked in the merchandise manager during shipping, or, if you want, manually under "Ordering system" > "Order process" > "Activate PAYONE transactions".

setup.plugins.paypalexpress.name: PayPal:
setup.plugins.paypalexpress.text:
enables payment via PayPal.

After the order process is finished, a pop-up will open, offering payment processing via PayPal.
All relevant data has already been entered, such as order confirmation number, amount, mail address; the customer simply has to enter his password in order to log in and confirm payment.




PayPal shipping/handling:
if activated, shipping and handling costs will be transferred to PayPal and will be displayed in highlighted form by PayPal.
Attention! Neither handling costs nor delivery charges may be negative, otherwise this feature will be automatically deactivated for the current order.

PayPal email address:
Enter your merchant email address.
You will receive it after registering with PayPal as a merchant/shop operator. The normal order email address cannot be used to receive payments.

PayPal description text:
This text is a description of the order via PayPal. The text cannot contain any umlauts or special characters. The [[order_number]] placeholder will be automatically replaced by the current order number.
Our recommendation: Order No.: [order_number]]

This text can be added in multiple languages, depending on how many languages you have defined.

setup.plugins.paypalexpress.xpl_paypalex.kurztext: Please take note of our integration guide below this help chapter.
setup.plugins.paypalexpress.xpl_paypalex.name: PayPal integration guide
setup.plugins.paypalexpress.xpl_paypalex.text:
The following steps are necessary to make sure your customers can shop using PayPal ExpressCheckout:

  1. Create a business PayPal account.
  2. Give your shop a so-called "API permission": Log into your PayPal Account, go to "My Profile"-> "Merchant" -> "API access".
    As your API Username enter "paypal_api1.cosmoshop.de" and give permission in the "Express payment processing" and "Reporting and Backoffice API".
  3. Give the following permissions to third-party-providers

    - use of the express purchase handling for your payment processes
    Initiation of a refund for a certain transaction'
    - Calling up information for a single transaction
    - Searching your transactions for articles that correspond to particular criteria 
      and displaying your results.

  4. Enter your PayPal email here.
  5. Activate the plug-in here ("activate PayPal ExpressCheckout")
  6. Create "PayPal" payment method (configuration order handling), in case it doesn't yet exist, and activate it.
  7. To test it, you can deactivate the "PayPal" payment method centrally and first activate it only for a certain customer group.


Notes:
Current PayPal terms and conditions are found here.
The current guides and information on the topic of PayPal merchant protection are found here.

setup.plugins.paypalexpress.xpl_paypalex.anzeigetitel: Bestellung nach Rckkehr von PayPal automatisch abschlieen und zahlung durchfhren?
setup.plugins.paypalexpress.xpl_paypalex.kurztext:
Wenn aktiviert, wird der Kunde, wenn er nicht den Express-Button auf der Warenkorbseite geklickt hat, sondern PayPal erst auf der Seite "Zahlung & Versand" ausgewhlt hat, erst nach der vorletzten Bestellseite (nach Klick auf "jetzt kostenpflichtig bestellen") zu PayPal weiter geleitet. Die Bestellung wird dann bei der Rckkehr automatisch abgeschlossen.

Ist diese Einstellung nicht aktiviert, wird der Kunde gleich nach der Seite "Zahlung & Versand" zum PayPal-Login weiter geleitet. Er whlt dort seine gewnschten zahlungsmodalitten aus, kehrt danach aber wieder zum Shop zurck, wo er noch einmal seine Bestellung im berblick sieht und bettigt dann erst "jetzt kostenpflichtig bestellen".

Je nach Einstellung wird auf den PayPal-Seiten der geeignete Text angezeigt. Sie mssen aber gggf. selbst den Hinweistext der Zahlart "PayPal" (hier in der Adminoberflche unter "Bestellablauf->Bestellvorgang->Zahlarten") anpassen.
setup.plugins.paypalexpress.xpl_paypalex.name: PayPal automatischer Zahlungsabschluss
setup.plugins.paypalexpress.xpl_paypalex.text:
Wenn aktiviert, wird der Kunde, wenn er nicht den Express-Button auf der Warenkorbseite geklickt hat, sondern PayPal erst auf der Seite "Zahlung & Versand" ausgewählt hat, erst nach der vorletzten Bestellseite (nach Klick auf "jetzt kostenpflichtig bestellen") zu PayPal weiter geleitet. Die Bestellung wird dann bei der Rückkehr automatisch abgeschlossen.

Ist diese Einstellung nicht aktiviert, wird der Kunde gleich nach der Seite "Zahlung & Versand" zum PayPal-Login weiter geleitet. Er wählt dort seine gewünschten zahlungsmodalitäten aus, kehrt danach aber wieder zum Shop zurück, wo er noch einmal seine Bestellung im Überblick sieht und betätigt dann erst "jetzt kostenpflichtig bestellen".

Je nach Einstellung wird auf den PayPal-Seiten der geeignete Text angezeigt. Sie müssen aber gggf. selbst den Hinweistext der Zahlart "PayPal" (hier in der Adminoberfläche unter "Bestellablauf->Bestellvorgang->Zahlarten") anpassen.

setup.plugins.paypalexpress.xpl_paypalex.text: which of the logos offered by PayPal would you like to use?

setup.plugins.paypalexpress.xpl_paypalex.kurztext: If activated, the PayPal payment method logo will appear on your shop pages.
setup.plugins.paypalexpress.xpl_paypalex.name: Display PayPal logo?
setup.plugins.paypalexpress.xpl_paypalex.text:
Display of the logo is required by PayPal.
For this reason, we recommend activating this function.

setup.plugins.paypalexpress.xpl_paypalex.kurztext: If activated, some customers can be led to the PayPal page after finishing their order to manually pay for it there. This will slow down the workflow. You can read Help for more info.
setup.plugins.paypalexpress.xpl_paypalex.name: Allow payment redirection?
setup.plugins.paypalexpress.xpl_paypalex.text: Here you can decide whether you want to allow payments that trigger redirection to PayPal after order completion. This payment types require customers to transfer the payment amount to PayPal (either via GiroPay or manually). Payment cannot be booked in the shop immediately. The article therefore cannot be immediately shipped. You have to wait for the payment receipt email. Not recommended...

setup.plugins.paypalexpress.xpl_paypalex.kurztext: If activated, the PayPal Expressbuy button will be shown on the shopping cart page and the customer will be led to PayPal from there. Alternatively, the customer can also go to PayPal from the payment methods selection page in the shop.
setup.plugins.paypalexpress.xpl_paypalex.name: Show Expressbuy button?
setup.plugins.paypalexpress.xpl_paypalex.text:
If activated, the PayPal Expressbuy button will be shown on the shopping cart page and the customer will be led to PayPal from there. Alternatively, the customer can also go to PayPal from the payment methods selection page in the shop.
WARNING: If this function is activated, you can no longer limit the "PayPal" payment method to certain countries and/or shipping types (like other payment methods, since shipping types aren't yet determined on the shopping cart page). The limitations according to customer group and shopping cart maximum amount are still applicable.

setup.plugins.paypalexpress.xpl_paypalex.kurztext: If it is activated, all PayPal transactions will be conducted with the "Sandbox" environment from PayPal.
setup.plugins.paypalexpress.xpl_paypalex.name: Test mode active
setup.plugins.paypalexpress.xpl_paypalex.text: only activate if the shop or "PayPal" payment method are not online yet.

setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..anzeigetitel: Order status for delayed payment completion
setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..name: Order status for delayed payment completion
setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..text:
This status is automatically set when payment completion of a pending payment is detected by the shop. For this purpose the shop hourly asks the PayPal server if a pending payment has arrived. Only after this status is set, the order may be shipped.

Kindly note that you can enrich the order status mail in the order status management area of the shop with an appropriate description text like "We have detected the receipt of payment for your order by now and will send out the ordered article(s) as soon as possible." in case the customer shall be notified about the status change be email.

setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..name: App Client ID
setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..text: The Client ID is a long, cryptical parameter that you can read at your PayPal PLUS Backend or request from your PayPal case handler.

setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..name: App Secret
setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..text: The Secret is a long, cryptical parameter that you can read at your PayPal PLUS Backend or request from your PayPal case handler.

setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..anzeigetitel: Lifetime of the automatic payment receipt test
setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..name: Lifetime of the automatic payment receipt test
setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..text:
only relevant for pending payments:

in this case an automatic background task checks each hour if the payment arrived. In this field you can provide the number of days this automatic test shall run until the order shall be cancelled. After the deadline has passed the order status in the subsequent setup field will be set if provided.

setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..name: Timeout status pending payments
setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..text:
when the lifetime of the automatic automatic payment receipt test has passed, this status will be set for the orrder.

Kindly note that you can enrich the order status mail in the order status management area of the shop with an appropriate description text like "Unfortunately we didn't recieve the payment for this order until now. We are sorry that we have to cancel the order therefore." in case the customer shall be notified about the status change be email.

setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..anzeigetitel: Payment instructions for direct Bank Transfer
setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..name: Payment instructions for direct Bank Transfer
setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..text:
If a customer choses direct bank transfer as payment option on the PayPal page, the amount has to be transfered to the PayPal account manually. Therefore PayPal provides accout data as transfer target, the customer has to be told of, as well as on the order confirmation page as well as in the order email. the payment instructions are provide by this text block

The following substitutions are designated:

Amount: %amount%
IBAN: %iban%
BIC: %bic%
Account Owner: %owner%
Bank Name: %bank%
Reference: %reference%

Kindly note! Please use the provided substitutions and do not enter your own bank data here.

setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..name: Description
setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..text: This text will be displayed along with the cart details on the PayPal page. The substitution %domain% will be automatically replaced with the shop's domain.

setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..anzeigetitel: Payment instructions for Pay upon Invoice
setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..name: Payment instructions for Pay upon Invoice
setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..text:
If a customer choses pay upon invoice as payment option on the PayPal page, the amount has to be transfered to the PayPal account manually. Therefore PayPal provides accout data as transfer target, the customer has to be told of, as well as on the order confirmation page as well as in the order email. the payment instructions are provide by this text block

The following substitutions are designated:

amount: %amount%
IBAN: %iban%
BIC: %bic%
account owner: %owner%
bank name: %bank%
reference: %reference%
due date for the payment: %due%

Kindly note! Please use the provided substitutions and do not enter your own bank data here.

setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..name: Live Mode
setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..text:
In the testing phase of the payment module you can use the sandbox mode by letting this option deactivated and entering the sandbox access parameters in this plugin setup.

Upon going live of the payment module, you fill in the live account data and activate the live mode here.

setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..name: Logo URL
setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..text: If an image URL is entered here (like from the shop logo in the header of the shop checkout), it will be shown on PayPal side

setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..name: Payment status for uncompleted payments
setup.plugins.paypalplus.xpl_paypalplus..text:
Uncompleted payments (status: "pending") will happen, when an user choses the payment method "Bank Transfer" within the PayPal account. In this case, the user performs a manual bank transfert to the bank account of PayPal, and only after PayPal detects the payment receipt, the shop is notified of the payment completion.

Ifthe payment is marked as uncomplete, the order status to be defined here is set for the order. Upon notification of payment completion, the status is set to the subsequent defined status for delayed payment completion.

Our recommendation is to chose an order status here like "Pending Payment" and in case create such a payment state in the payment state administration of the shop. Orders with this payment state must not be shipped.

 Kindly note that you can enrich the order status mail in the order status management area of the shop with an appropriate description text like "Please transfer the order amount to the bank account we have told you within the order confirmation email" in case the customer shall be notified about the status change be email.

setup.plugins.pixi.name: Pixi:
setup.plugins.pixi.text:
Pixi* is a specialized order delivery management software, which enables efficient shipping of your goods.
As soon as you receive the corresponding parameters from Pixi, you can enter them here.
Some paths have to be transferred to Pixi, which you will find UNDER the gray box.
We will ensure a smooth installation.

setup.plugins.pixi.xpl_pixi.pixi_dbname.name: DB name
setup.plugins.pixi.xpl_pixi.pixi_dbname.text: the Pixi database name. Pixi support will provide you with this value.

setup.plugins.pixi.xpl_pixi.pixi_shopid.name: Shop ID
setup.plugins.pixi.xpl_pixi.pixi_shopid.text: The Pixi shop ID (as a rule a 3-letter code). This value will be provided by Pixi support.

setup.plugins.pixi.xpl_pixi.pixi_versend.name: Shipper
setup.plugins.pixi.xpl_pixi.pixi_versend.text: The shipper ID in Pixi, such as DHL

setup.plugins.pixi.xpl_pixi.pixi_waehrun.name: Currency
setup.plugins.pixi.xpl_pixi.pixi_waehrun.text: The currency set in Pixi, as a rule EUR

setup.plugins.qenta.name: Qenta:
setup.plugins.qenta.text:
enables payment via automatic debit transfer, credit card and other payment methods registered with Qenta.
Payments made via this "online clearing" interface are automatically booked to your account. The goods can be automatically shipped right after such an order has been received, since the payment has already taken place (in contrast to advance payment, for example)
You can register for Qenta via this link: www.qenta.at



It is recommended that you activate this interface.
Enter the described parameters, which you will receive after approx. 7 days from Qenta.
You can also define the used currency here.

In the "Ordering system "->"Order process"->"Payment types" set a checkmark next to the corresponding payment types in order to let these run via Qenta.
Payment data in the order process/shopping cart area will then be transferred to Qenta in the background, unnoticed by the customer.
If an "OK" code comes back, the order will be shipped or confirmed.
If a "NOT OK" code comes back, an error message will come back and the order cannot be shipped.

setup.plugins.qenta.xpl_qenta.qenta_besc.kurztext: Transferred to Qenta as the booking reference.
setup.plugins.qenta.xpl_qenta.qenta_besc.name: Reference:
setup.plugins.qenta.xpl_qenta.qenta_besc.text: This value will be transferred to Qenta as the booking reference.

setup.plugins.qenta.xpl_qenta.qenta_cust.name: Parameter "Customer number"
setup.plugins.qenta.xpl_qenta.qenta_cust.text: This parameter will be provided by Qenta. Please fill this out so that the interface can function.

setup.plugins.qenta.xpl_qenta.qenta_fehl.kurztext: will appear if Qenta returns FAILURE status when the attempt to pay via Qenta has failed.
setup.plugins.qenta.xpl_qenta.qenta_fehl.name: Payment not required
setup.plugins.qenta.xpl_qenta.qenta_fehl.text: This error message will be shown if Qenta returns a FAILURE status if the attempt to pay via Qenta has failed.

setup.plugins.qenta.xpl_qenta.qenta_fehl.kurztext: will be shown if the "md5 key" doesn't match.
setup.plugins.qenta.xpl_qenta.qenta_fehl.name: Error text
setup.plugins.qenta.xpl_qenta.qenta_fehl.text: This error message will be shown if the "md 5 key" doesn't match.

setup.plugins.qenta.xpl_qenta.qenta_im_i.kurztext: if active, the Qenta payment process will be integrated directly into the shop. Otherwise it will take place on an external page.
setup.plugins.qenta.xpl_qenta.qenta_im_i.name: Payment process in the shop?
setup.plugins.qenta.xpl_qenta.qenta_im_i.text:
If active, the Wirecard payment process will be integrated directly in the shop. Otherwise it will take place on an external page.

Please note: the iFrame solution requires JavaScript on the customer's browser (98% of all browsers support it).

setup.plugins.qenta.xpl_qenta.qenta_layo.name: Layout
setup.plugins.qenta.xpl_qenta.qenta_layo.text:
For the layout Wirecard provides 3 different templates

Our recommendation is the "Tablet" template, as it is responsive as well as "Smartphone" is, and looks well on mobile devices as well as dektop PCs while "Desktop" is not mobile optimized at all. The "Smarthone" templates uses one column while the "Layout" template has two and changes to one when being displayed on a smartphone.

Please test the correct appearance of the payment mask on Wirecard side after changing this setup, because in some cases the layout parameter will cause Wirecard to display an layout error instead of the tablet display. In this case, please contact your Wirecard clerk directly.

setup.plugins.qenta.xpl_qenta.qenta_logo.name: Logo URL
setup.plugins.qenta.xpl_qenta.qenta_logo.text: If an image URL is entered here (like from the shop logo in the header of the shop checkout), it will be shown in the wircard frame

setup.plugins.qenta.xpl_qenta.qenta_secr.name: Parameter "Secret"
setup.plugins.qenta.xpl_qenta.qenta_secr.text: This parameter will be provided by Qenta. Please fill this out so that the interface can function.

setup.plugins.reminder.name: Payment on delivery reminder:
setup.plugins.reminder.text:
Reminder email for a payment on delivery order.
Send automatically after x number of days when a customer orders using "payment on delivery".
You can edit the email template under "Order process"->"Email texts".

setup.plugins.reminder.xpl_reminder.remi.kurztext: When active, the customer will receive a reminder email if he ordered using payment on delivery method.
setup.plugins.reminder.xpl_reminder.remi.name: Activation of the payment on delivery reminder email.
setup.plugins.reminder.xpl_reminder.remi.text:
When active, the customer will receive a reminder email if he ordered using payment on delivery method.
You can edit the text under:
Order process > Email texts > Manage payment on delivery reminder

setup.plugins.reminder.xpl_reminder.remi.kurztext: days after delivery (NOTE: must be under 14)
setup.plugins.reminder.xpl_reminder.remi.name: Send reminder email after x days
setup.plugins.reminder.xpl_reminder.remi.text:
After this number of days (after the order is sent off) the reminder email will be sent out.
The value must be below 14. (recommended for normal shipping duration: 1)

setup.plugins.rezension.name: Article evaluation:
setup.plugins.rezension.text:
Optional module, which allows evaluation of articles using a review. Here, logged-in customers can enter a text for an article, which will then appear under the article description in the article overview (similar to accessories, or cross-selling articles).
After release/processing of the review by the shop operator, it will be visible in the shop.

You can activate the whole function and determine how many reviews should be normally displayed. If more reviews exist than the value set here, the visitor can view all reviews via a link.

setup.plugins.rezension.xpl_rezension.ma.kurztext: The maximum number of article reviews for articles that will be normally shown (the shop visitor can view all reviews if needed)
setup.plugins.rezension.xpl_rezension.ma.name: Number of reviews displayed
setup.plugins.rezension.xpl_rezension.ma.text:
The value entered here defines the directly shown reviews (article evaluations). Additional available reviews can still be viewed by clicking on a link.

Recommended value: 2-4

setup.plugins.rezension.xpl_rezension.re.name: Activation of the article review function
setup.plugins.rezension.xpl_rezension.re.text: If you activate this module, any customer in your shop can review an article. This is an important social media plug-in, which can have a big impact on the purchase behavior of other customers.

setup.plugins.shipcloud.xpl_shipcloud.sh.name: DHL Express available?
setup.plugins.shipcloud.xpl_shipcloud.sh.text: Activate tis, when DHL Express is available for your shipcloud account.

setup.plugins.shipcloud.xpl_shipcloud.sh.name: DPD: predict
setup.plugins.shipcloud.xpl_shipcloud.sh.text:
DPD allows recipients to be notified of a pending delivery within the next hour. The so called predict service can be used with shipcloud by specifying it as an additional service. You can either specify the email address or phone number of your customer to be notified.

Please note: if not activated, DPD will (as stated in Dec 2015) charge additional fees for the second and third delivery attempt.

setup.plugins.shipcloud.xpl_shipcloud.sh.kurztext: Default height of packages. You can overwrite itndividually for each package
setup.plugins.shipcloud.xpl_shipcloud.sh.name: Default height of packages

setup.plugins.shipcloud.xpl_shipcloud.sh.kurztext: Default length of packages. You can overwrite itndividually for each package.
setup.plugins.shipcloud.xpl_shipcloud.sh.name: Default length of packages

setup.plugins.shipcloud.xpl_shipcloud.sh.kurztext: Default width of packages. You can overwrite itndividually for each package
setup.plugins.shipcloud.xpl_shipcloud.sh.name: Default width of packages
Email notification
setup.plugins.shipcloud.xpl_shipcloud.sh.text: If activated, the email adress of your customer will be submitted to Shipcloud. The customer gets notificated by Shipcloud once there’s an update for this shipment.

setup.plugins.shopshare.xpl_shopshare.sh.name: clientID
setup.plugins.shopshare.xpl_shopshare.sh.text: This parameter will be provided by ShopShare

setup.plugins.shopshare.xpl_shopshare.sh.name: clientName
setup.plugins.shopshare.xpl_shopshare.sh.text: This parameter will be provided by ShopShare

setup.plugins.shopshare.xpl_shopshare.sh.name: clientPassword
setup.plugins.shopshare.xpl_shopshare.sh.text: This parameter will be provided by ShopShare

setup.plugins.shopshare.xpl_shopshare.sh.name: clientUsername
setup.plugins.shopshare.xpl_shopshare.sh.text: This parameter will be provided by ShopShare

setup.plugins.shopshare.xpl_shopshare.sh.anzeigetitel: Set delivery charges according to weight
setup.plugins.shopshare.xpl_shopshare.sh.name: Set delivery charges according to weight
setup.plugins.shopshare.xpl_shopshare.sh.text:
If activated, article weight will be transferred to ShopShare as a shipping unit, otherwise just the price.

delivery charges can be stored in ShopShare according to shipping unit. (Shop-Config -> Delivery/Payment -> Select country -> Courier tab -> Select courier)
Example:

Delivery according to price (no delivery charge starting from 100 Euro, delivery charge 4.90 Euro):
"Scale delivery charges according to weight" checkbox deactivated
Configuration in ShopShare:
Quantity span 1: from 1 to 99.99
Quantity span 2: from 100.00 to 999999.00
delivery charges for quantity span 1: 4.90
delivery charges for quantity span 2: 0.00

Delivery according to weight (delivery charge 4.90 Euro, starting from 20 kg additional 5.00 Euro):
"Delivery charges scaled according to weight" checkbox activated
Configuration in ShopShare:
Quantity span 1: from 1 to 19.99
Quantity span 2: from 20.00 to 999999.00
Delivery charge for quantity span 1: 4.90
Delivery charge for quantity span 2: 9.90

This configuration option also determines whether the reference value for the quantity span is given to ShopShare in EUR (goods value) or in kg (goods weight). The configuration there must then be adjusted correspondingly.

setup.plugins.shopshare.xpl_shopshare.sh.name: use real inventory?
setup.plugins.shopshare.xpl_shopshare.sh.text:
If activated, all of the shop's inventory will be transferred to ShopShare. ShopShare automatically deactivates articles whose inventory sinks to 0.

Please use this option only when shop inventory is regularly updated.

setup.plugins.shopzilla.name: Shopzilla export:
setup.plugins.shopzilla.text:
Interface to a product portal.
Here you can indicate which delivery charges should be displayed by Shopzilla, or starting when no delivery charges should be shown.

If you would like to track the clicks from the portal to the shop, activate the corresponding checkbox here.
You will then receive detailed statistics in the Shopzilla administration area.
To allow tracking to work, you have to enter your Shopzilla merchant ID on this page.

Shopzilla questionnaire:
Appears as a pop-up during activation after the order is sent off.

setup.plugins.shopzilla.xpl_shopzilla.sh.kurztext: the Conversion Tracking Code from Shopzilla will be embedded. Functional only in combination with Shopzilla merchant ID
setup.plugins.shopzilla.xpl_shopzilla.sh.name: Activate Shopzilla tracking code
setup.plugins.shopzilla.xpl_shopzilla.sh.text: If you measure or display the relationship between clicks to orders in the Shopzilla back-end, you should activate this function.

setup.plugins.shopzilla.xpl_shopzilla.sh.name: Merchant ID
setup.plugins.shopzilla.xpl_shopzilla.sh.text: Serves to verify when using Shopzilla Conversion Tracker

setup.plugins.shopzilla.xpl_shopzilla.sh.kurztext: This will display the Shopzilla questionnaire at the end of the order.
setup.plugins.shopzilla.xpl_shopzilla.sh.name: Display the Shopzilla questionnaire at the end of the order?
setup.plugins.shopzilla.xpl_shopzilla.sh.text: This will display the Shopzilla questionnaire at the end of the order.

setup.plugins.shopzilla.xpl_shopzilla.sh.name: Define delivery charges for Shopzilla
setup.plugins.shopzilla.xpl_shopzilla.sh.text:
The complex delivery charge calculation of the shop cannot be used in the "Shopzilla" portal. For this reason, estimated delivery charges must be defined here.

Tip:
So that articles can be exported actively, you must trigger export under "Promotion Tools > Price portal export . Shopzilla.
It's best to do this after you have changed the article.

setup.plugins.shopzilla.xpl_shopzilla.sh.kurztext: (Amount without currency indicators) starting from which article will be exported as "Free delivery". 0.00 for deliveries with no free delivery.
setup.plugins.shopzilla.xpl_shopzilla.sh.name: Free delivery threshold
setup.plugins.shopzilla.xpl_shopzilla.sh.text: (Amount without currency indicators) starting from which article will be exported as "Free delivery". 0.00 for deliveries with no free delivery.

setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.Skrill_F.name: Error; Skrill
setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.Skrill_F.text:
With an active Skrill interface:

Payment cannot be authorized for various reasons and the indicated error message will be issued.

setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.skrill_b.kurztext: Notification of payment will be sent to this email address. The notification email will come directly from Skrill.
setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.skrill_b.name: Email address for payment notifications
setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.skrill_b.text: Notification of payment will be sent to this email address. The notification email will come directly from Skrill.

setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.skrill_e.kurztext: The saved email address of your Skrill merchant account for receiving payments.
setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.skrill_e.name: Email address payment
setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.skrill_e.text: The saved email address of your Skrill merchant account. This address receives payments (similar to PayPal).

setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.skrill_f.kurztext: Displaying this on the Skrill payment page should reassure customers that the payment recipient is one and the same as the shop operator. If empty, the email address will be displayed.
setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.skrill_f.name: Company name on payment side.
setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.skrill_f.text: This text will appear on the Skrill payment page and should reassure customers that the payment recipient is one and the same as the shop operator. If empty, the email address will be displayed.

setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.skrill_i.name: "Customer ID" parameter
setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.skrill_i.text: This parameter is provided to you by Skrill. Please enter it here so that the supporting interface can function.

setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.skrill_i.anzeigetitel: Payment process directly in the shop?
setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.skrill_i.kurztext: if activated, the payment process will take place IN THE SHOP and not on an external page.
setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.skrill_i.name: Start Skrill payment process  in iFrame/shop
setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.skrill_i.text:
Instead of sending parameters directly to Skrill, an iFrame intermediate page will open and the Skrill payment process will be started directly inside the shop (in an iFrame).
Please note: the iFrame solution requires JavaScript on the customer's browser (98% of visitors have this).

setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.skrill_l.kurztext: Enter your shop's URL here. The logo will then appear on the Skrill intermediate page in order to signal your customers that they are still in your shop. Leave empty to show no logo.
setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.skrill_l.name: Shop logo URL
setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.skrill_l.text:
Enter the URL of your logo here.
You can get the URL of your logo by right-clicking on the logo and then selecting "Properties".

The logo will then appear on the Skrill intermediate page, signaling your customers that they are still in your shop. Leave empty if you don't want any logo to appear.

setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.skrill_p.name: Payment gateway URL
setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.skrill_p.text: this URL is created statically by Skrill and can be changed in case moneybookers changes their name following an announcement by Skrill.

setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.skrill_s.kurztext: (not the login password for the merchant account) The password is found under "Merchant settings"
setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.skrill_s.name: "Password" parameter
setup.plugins.skrill.xpl_skrill.skrill_s.text:
The merchant account login password is meant here.

Please log in to Skrill with your merchant account data, then click on the "Merchant settings" menu.
There you can save a "Password", which has to be entered identically as it is here.
It is required to enter this password in order to check the authenticity of the order.

setup.plugins.sofortueberweisung.name: Instant bank transfer:
setup.plugins.sofortueberweisung.text:
enables automated payment using advance payment.

When immediate bank transfer is selected as the payment method, a pop-up window will open after the order is sent off where the bank details you entered before will appear. The customer must then log in to his online banking portal with his PIN (integrated directly in the window) and confirm payment with a TAN number. After payment is finished, the order will be sent off in the shop.



Enter the described parameters on this page.
After logging-in for immediate transfer, please create a new project in the IT administration.
You will then receive all required parameters.
We can also take care of this process for you.
Please get in touch with us.

Reference 1+2:
Appears when bestsellers are booked.
Various placeholders make it possible to insert values that are inserted with the order.
For example:
is automatically replaced with the shop's domain, but it isn't necessary to enter it. Is automatically replaced in Button Mode by the order number.
Additional placeholders:
: First name according to the billing address
: Last name according to the billing address
: entered account holder
is automatically replaced with the shop's domain, but it isn't necessary to enter it.
Is automatically replaced in Button Mode by the order number.

We will be glad to send you additional information per email.

setup.plugins.sofortueberweisung.xpl_sof.kurztext: Your notification password for www.sofort.com (not your login password or the project password)
setup.plugins.sofortueberweisung.xpl_sof.name: Notification password
setup.plugins.sofortueberweisung.xpl_sof.text: Your notification password for www.sofort.com (not your login password or the project password)

setup.plugins.sofortueberweisung.xpl_sof.name: Customer number
setup.plugins.sofortueberweisung.xpl_sof.text:
The customer number is universally valid.
The following project number refers to individual shops.
You can create multiple "projects" in the SU back-end, one for each shop that you're operating.

You can learn more at (including merchant registration):

https://www.sofort-ueberweisung.de/payment/users/register/27

setup.plugins.sofortueberweisung.xpl_sof.kurztext: Your project password from sofort.com (not the login password, but a new password you have created in the project)
setup.plugins.sofortueberweisung.xpl_sof.name: Project password
setup.plugins.sofortueberweisung.xpl_sof.text: Your project password from sofort.com (not the login password, but a new password you have created in the project)

setup.plugins.sofortueberweisung.xpl_sof.kurztext: first, create a project in SU, then add it here.
setup.plugins.sofortueberweisung.xpl_sof.name: Project number
setup.plugins.sofortueberweisung.xpl_sof.text:
You can create multiple "projects" in SU, e.g. one for each shop you operate.
Please note our integration instructions or leave the payment interface setup to us.

setup.plugins.sofortueberweisung.xpl_sof.kurztext:
available placeholders:
<Domain> : will be automatically replaced by the shop's domain
<Name>: first name according to the billing address <Last_name>: last name according to the billing address : Last name according to the billing address

setup.plugins.telecashipg.name: Telecash:
setup.plugins.telecashipg.text:
enables payment via direct debit, credit card.
Payments processed using this "online clearing" interface are booked automatically from your account. Goods are sent immediately after such an order is received, since the payment process has already taken place (as opposed to prepayment, for example).
Registration for Telecash takes place through us - we forward the approved application together with technical information to Telecash.


Activate this interface on this page as a rule.
Enter the described parameters, which you will receive after approx. 7 days from Telecash.
You can also determine the currency accepted.

In the "Ordering system"->"Order process"->"Payment methods" you can set a checkmark next to the corresponding payment types in order to let these go through Telecash.
Payment information will be encoded in the Ordering system / checkout area and unnoticeably for the visitor, set to Telecash in the background.
If an "OK" code comes back, the order will be sent off or confirmed.
If a "NOT OK" code comes back, an error report appears and the order can't be sent.

setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.name: Note; credit rating not accepted
setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.text: If credit rating is not accepted during the automatic direct debit via Telecash, this payment method is then unavailable and the error report entered here will appear.

setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.kurztext: If activated, a required checkbox will appear for automated debit transfer for agreeing to a credit rating check in order step 4
setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.name: Show credit rating checkbox in the checkout area?
setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.text:
If activated, a required checkbox will appear for agreement to a credit rating check in order step 4 of direct debit through Telecash IPG.
It is prescribed that customers are informed that credit rating checks are made in the background, AND they must additionally actively agree to it.

setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.name: Telecash store ID
setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.text: This parameter will be provided by Telecash. Please fill it in so that the payment interface can function.

setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.kurztext: Data entry for Telecash, embedded in an iFrame
setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.name: Data in iFrame
setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.text:
In this case data entry always takes place on Telecash pages which are displayed in the shop as an iFrame.

Please note that when using the Giropay payment method, iFrames are automatically not used, since the Giropay technology forbids iFrames.
In this case, the customer is sent to the entry page of the payment method provider.

setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.kurztext: Which credit cards have you checked off in the contract and which ones are already contracted?
setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.name: Credit cards
setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.text:
Please check off credit cards for which you have acquirer contracts.
We will be happy to recommend cooperation partners for setting up credit card contracts.
If you have already signed a contract, you have to provide Telecash with a VU number (acquirer contract number).

setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.kurztext: Switch to LIVE after you have received your Telecash ID.
setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.name: Mode / Operating mode
setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.text: Demo mode enables interface testing with dummy bank data. We are happy to take care of the interface integration and testing.

setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.kurztext: Credit card data entry directly with Telecash, no entry in the shop.
setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.name: Credit card entry with Telecash
setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.text:
If the checkbox is activated, credit card data entry takes place not in the shop, but directly on telecash pages.

Please note that even in the case of a deactivated checkbox, data will be entered in a form created by the shop, but once sent, it will be transferred to Telecash without coming in contact with the shop.

Lack of shop contact with credit card data is legally required and will be the case whether this checkbox is marked or not.

setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.kurztext: Bank data entry directly with Telecash, no entry in the shop.
setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.name: Bank data entry with Telecash
setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.text:
If the checkbox is checked, bank data entry takes place not in the shop, but directly on the Telecash website.

Please note that even in the case of a deactivated checkbox, data will be entered in a form created by the shop, but once sent, it will be transferred to Telecash without coming in contact with the shop.

setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.kurztext: Should credit card bookings take place immediately, together with order shipping, or later during merchandise management, for example?
setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.name: only preAuth / only preauthorize amount?
setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.text:
Should the credit card booking take place immediately when the order is sent off or later, e.g. in the merchandise management/order delivery management software?

Warning!
Your merchandise management software must support this function.

setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.name: Telecash Shared Secret
setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.text: This parameter will be provided by Telecash. Please fill it in so that the payment interface can function.

setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.kurztext: Security process with PIN entry during the payment process. More information available in Help.
setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.name: 3D Secure / Verified by Visa
setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.text:
This process should create more security in the credit card payment exchange.

Requirements:
Your credit card contract must include this feature.

Advantages:
For you as a merchant, this process means reversal of liability:
this means that YOU do not have to pay for fraud or prove damages, but the bank does.
For the customer, the Secure process means that in an intermediate step in the order process (during sending of the order), a pop-up window will require the entry of the credit card PIN.

Disadvantages:
If the customer doesn't have the PIN readily available, he won't be able to continue and will have to choose another payment method.
Not all credit cards offer this feature. In Germany, this is valid only for 20-30% of all cards. However, the liability reversal still applies even if fraud is performed with a card that's not secured with a security code.

You can find out more about this topic under:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/3-D_Secure

setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.kurztext: Kindly note that your Payment Service Provider (PSP) has to support the selected method. Please contact your PSP to find out, from when respectively until when the methods will be supported.

setup.plugins.telecashipg.xpl_telecaship.text:
You can choose here, if you want to show whether the SEPA fields (BIC/IBAN) or the classic Account Number / BIN) within the bank account form. You can also choose to show both variants and let your customer decide for himself.

Kindly note that your Payment Service Provider (PSP) has to support the selected method. Please contact your PSP to find out, from when respectively until when the methods will be supported.

Various categories require different filters most of the time. For this reason it is recommended to activate this setting. Otherwise, the visitor's search results will be limited based on his previously defined values.

We recommend activating this setting.

Visitor-defined filters can be applied within a category. Theoretically, a sub-category can contain fewer filters than the mother category. In this case, this filter will be removed.

partially optional module, depending on the type of operation (ECO / stand-alone)

On this page you can activate the function (transfer customer data to TrustedShops) and display of the TrustedShops seal.

TrustedShops is the well-known Internet quality seal for online shops with a money-back guarantee for their customers. During a certification, your shop will be comprehensively inspected for security. This test with more than 100 criteria is based on consumer protection requirements as well as national and European law.

Because we have worked together with TrustedShops when developing this shop software, most of these requirements have already been met. Your advantage: you can be certified without much effort and at a discount, reaping all the benefits!

The TrustedShop effect
Quality seal + Money-back guarantee + Service = Trust

More than 1,000 successful online merchants depend on TrustedShops today and offer a worry-free shopping experience on the web. This makes TrustedShops the clear market leader in Germany. Use the recognizable No. 1 Internet seal with money-back guarantee for your page!

What does TrustedShops offer you?

•  Trusted Shops practice manual with sample shop
•  Certification of your online shop with individual check list
•  Personal contact person for all inquiries
•  Updates concerning legal developments and relevant decisions
•  Money-back guarantee for your customers
•  Multi-language service center for your customers
•  Professional conflict resolution in case of problems
•  Access to Trusted Shops expert forums
•  Exclusive partner offers (payment, hosting, marketing, etc.)
•  Shop profile with logo and link (search engine optimized)

Your Trusted Shops advantages:

•  More customers - thanks to integrated marketing
•  More sales and cash in advance - thanks to higher consumer confidence
•  More advertising - via portal and newsletter
•  More offers - through partners and service providers
•  More customer loyalty - thanks to expanded customer service

More information and testimonials from certified online shops can be found on the Trusted Shops start page under www.trustedshops.com .

Use the special offers for shop customers and have your shop certified

setup.plugins.urloptimierung.name: URL optimization
setup.plugins.urloptimierung.text:
With URL optimization, the shop makes available a new generation of URLs, which use meaningful key values and drastically shorten the entire URL. The following three URL formats are offered to this effect:


-       http://www.domain.de/[Artikel-Begriff].htm
for articles


-       http://www.domain.de/[Hauptrubrik-Begriff]/[Unterrubrik-Begriff]/index.htm for categories


-       http://www.domain.de/Infos/[Zusatzseiten-Name].htm
for additional pages


 


The article and main category or subcategory terms can be assigned in any way you like and will be assigned by the shop completely automatically, if possible (based on article name or the category name). The keys for the additional pages are created automatically from their names.


To make short URLs possible, only the shop's "standard requests“ are displayed in short form, but as soon as specific session data is available (such as shopping cart contents), the compact version is no longer possible in order to avoid duplicate content. Recognized search engines always see the compact URLs, leaving only the article and category views indexed for search engines for the midterm.


Good to know:


URL optimization uses cookies. Only after the cookie has been set can the short version be displayed (until then you will see a version with /nocache prefix or the old URL). There are two standard options:


a)     older shops and deep links in shops set the cookie during the first shop visit. Because it isn't clear at first whether the browser really accepts cookies, for the following pages a compact URL with a "nocache/" -prefix and shopping cart ID is created. Only after such a URL is opened and the transferred shopping cart ID is matched to the cookie will the compact URL be shown.


b)    a current shop is opened via the pure domain. Because the start page is an index.shtml, a cookie can't be set during the first visit (although an attempt to do so is made). For this reason, the "nocache" version of the URL is shown. If this page is opened, the cookie can be set correctly, but for the current page there is a problem, since the previously set cookie doesn't correspond with the previously saved one. For this reason, the compatibility mode is activated and the displayed links are made in the old format. Therefore: 1st click has nocache URL, 2nd click has a URL in the old format, and starting from the 3rd click you will start seeing compact URLs. This does NOT obstruct search engines.


As soon as content is available in the shopping cart, the URLs switch to the "nocache" version in order to avoid caching in the customer browser (because the mini shopping cart changes, the cached "blank" page cannot be displayed here.


Whether the customer sees a non-cached URL or, in compatibility mode (see b), an old URL, the search engines always see the compact URLs, because it is assumed that they will not log in or place anything in the shopping cart. The nocache URLs aren't as eye-catching as the customer would ideally like, but they are irrelevant from the point of view of search engines.


Important: to display the compact URLs for detail views from the list view, the browse links in the detail view must be deactivated. This is because browse links are used to navigate through the history (and the backlink to the category view, etc.) and interfere with the URL. If the URL has been optimized, this parameter would be lost and the backlinks wouldn't work. For this reason, these URLs aren't optimized, as long as these parameters exist (they will disappear if browse links are deactivated).


In the current URL optimization there is a URL key generator, which automatically tries to set the fitting URL key using article names and category names (normalized version of the name). If this generator isn't available yet, you can add it with just a few clicks. Warning: the generator creates a URL key only when it is unique. If the URL key is already taken by another article, the URL key field will remain empty (otherwise http://domain.com/[Urlkey].htm wouldn't be unique.

setup.plugins.urloptimierung.xpl_urlopti.kurztext: short form of the shop URL is activated with cookie support
setup.plugins.urloptimierung.xpl_urlopti.name: Activate URL optimization
setup.plugins.urloptimierung.xpl_urlopti.text:
Please note that optimized URLs cannot be displayed if the page contains specialized content such as the customer's name after a lo-in or with articles in the shopping cart. Also special parameters in URLs (such as when browser links are used on the detail page) prevent URLs from being presented in compact form.

Because it cannot be determined whether a cookie set by the server is really saved by the browser, (this depends on the browser's security settings) "expanded" URLs will be shown until it can be made sure that the cookie is read from the customer's browser. In contrast, search engines always see the compact URL, and not these makeshift, expanded URLs.

Here you can find more information about the "short URL" topic:

http://www.shopbetreiber-blog.de/2008/06/20/7-tipps-fuer-optimale-url/

setup.plugins.wirecard.name: WireCard:
setup.plugins.wirecard.text:
enables payment with bank transfer, credit card and other payment methods.
Other services such as "address check", "scoring" and "fraud protection" can be booked via WireCard.

Payments made via this "online clearing" interface will be automatically booked and written to your account. Goods can be shipped immediately after receiving such an order, since the payment process has already taken place (in contrast to prepayment, for example).

Registration for WireCard takes place through us. We will then forward the checked application supplemented with technical data to WireCard.

We will gladly send you more information per email.


Activation of this interface is generally recommended.
Fill out the described parameters, which you will receive from WireCard approx. 7 days later.
You can also determine the accepted currency.

In the "Ordering system"->"Order process"->"Payment methods" menu you can set a checkmark next to the corresponding payment methods to let these run via WireCard.

The payment data will be encrypted in the Ordering system / checkout area and (unnoticed by the customer) transferred to WireCard.
If an "OK" code comes back, the order will be sent or confirmed.
If a "NOT OK" code returns, an error message appears and the order cannot be sent.

setup.plugins.wirecard.xpl_wirecard.wire.kurztext: General activation of the WireCard payment interface
setup.plugins.wirecard.xpl_wirecard.wire.name: Activation of the WireCard payment interface
setup.plugins.wirecard.xpl_wirecard.wire.text:
Here you can activate the payment interface.
Please note that you have to make additional settings in Ordering system > Order process > Payment methods.

setup.plugins.wk_zuschlag.xpl_wk_zuschla.name: Reference:
setup.plugins.wk_zuschlag.xpl_wk_zuschla.text:
Here you can decide whether you want to add or subtract a charge from the value of the goods.

An surcharge could be the processing or packaging fee.

A subtracted amount could be an automatic percent rebate that kicks in after reaching a certain order value. Note: In this case, not each individual price would be rebated, but it will appear in the shopping cart as an extra post with the total rebate.

Please note that some article groups (such as books) cannot be legally rebated.

setup.plugins.wk_zuschlag.xpl_wk_zuschla.name: virtual article number
setup.plugins.wk_zuschlag.xpl_wk_zuschla.text:
Here you can enter under which article number the rebate/additional fee should appear in the order. The article number is a required field.

If you have no stipulations to this in your merchandise management software, you can use straightforward article numbers such as "rebate" or "processing fee". Just make sure that this article number isn't already assigned to a real article. Please note that the "coupon" article number isn't allowed here, since it is already used for coupon redemptions.

setup.plugins.wk_zuschlag.xpl_wk_zuschla.name: Posting designation
setup.plugins.wk_zuschlag.xpl_wk_zuschla.text:
designation entered here will be used in the order process and the order emails.

Example: "Packaging flat fee"

setup.plugins.wk_zuschlag.xpl_wk_zuschla.name: Gross threshold value
setup.plugins.wk_zuschlag.xpl_wk_zuschla.text:
enter the gross value of goods that you would like to use as a threshold value (look at the configuration point for the possibility that it relates to this threshold value).

This threshold value will then be consulted for orders with gross price display, while for net price orders, the value will be ignored.

setup.plugins.wk_zuschlag.xpl_wk_zuschla.name: Net threshold
setup.plugins.wk_zuschlag.xpl_wk_zuschla.text:
enter the net goods value that you would like to use as a threshold (also check the configuration point in case it relates to this threshold value).

This threshold value will be consulted in the case of a net price order, while for orders with gross prices this value will be ignored.

setup.plugins.wk_zuschlag.xpl_wk_zuschla.name: Surcharge/rebate maturity
setup.plugins.wk_zuschlag.xpl_wk_zuschla.text:
Here you can determine the maturity of the fee/rebate in relation to the goods value. The goods value will be compared to the entered gross/net threshold value.

The surcharge/rebate is activated

  • when it is "above the threshold value": if the goods value is higher than the threshold value
  • when it is "above or equal to the threshold value": if the goods value is higher or equal to the threshold value
  • when the value is "below the threshold value": if the goods value is lower as the threshold
  • when the value is "below or equal to the threshold value": if the goods value is lower or equal to the threshold value

setup.plugins.wk_zuschlag.xpl_wk_zuschla.name: Surcharge/rebate value
setup.plugins.wk_zuschlag.xpl_wk_zuschla.text:
Here you can enter the net value of the surcharge/rebate as a positive absolute value or as a percentage. The VAT calculation will take place automatically based on the sales tax rate number 3 (currently 19%)

Example: 3% : a 3% surcharge/rebate added to the goods value.

Example: 1.64: a surcharge/rebate of 1.64 Euro net (gross: 1.95 Euro)

Coupons, shipping fees and payment fees are not included in the value of goods calculation.

Please note: Rebates are signified here with positive values and the sign is implied by the "application".

setup.plugins.wklayer_crosselling.xpl_wk.anzeigetitel: Upper limit of articles to be displayed
setup.plugins.wklayer_crosselling.xpl_wk.kurztext: Accessory articles have priority: If the limit is reached by accessory articles alone, cross-selling articles will not be shown even when activated.
setup.plugins.wklayer_crosselling.xpl_wk.name: Upper limit of articles to be displayed
setup.plugins.wklayer_crosselling.xpl_wk.text:
With this module you can point your customers' attention to additional products. Products are listed only with an activated shopping cart/pop-up/layer. In this layer desired products are listed.

We recommend setting a value between 3-7. Otherwise, the pop-up will become too crowded.

setup.plugins.wklayer_crosselling.xpl_wk.kurztext: Should cross selling articles be shown?
setup.plugins.wklayer_crosselling.xpl_wk.name: Show cross-selling articles
setup.plugins.wklayer_crosselling.xpl_wk.text: Articles that are already defined as cross-selling articles and are listed in the article detail view appear as cross-selling articles in the shopping cart layer as long as the checkbox here is activated. The cross-selling articles will be listed below the accessory articles, if these are available.

setup.plugins.wklayer_crosselling.xpl_wk.kurztext: If active, only articles in stock will be displayed
setup.plugins.wklayer_crosselling.xpl_wk.name: only show articles in stock
setup.plugins.wklayer_crosselling.xpl_wk.text: We recommend that you list only articles in stock here. This checkbox should be checked.

setup.plugins.wklayer_crosselling.xpl_wk.kurztext: Show accessory articles for the article?
setup.plugins.wklayer_crosselling.xpl_wk.name: Show accessory articles
setup.plugins.wklayer_crosselling.xpl_wk.text: Articles that are already defined as accessory articles and appear listed in the article detail view appear as cross-selling articles in the shopping cart layer if the checkbox here is activated.

setup.plugins.wunschpreis.name: Target prices:
setup.plugins.wunschpreis.text:
The user can enter his target price for the article. The appearance of the box necessary for this will then be found in the article detail view.
The interested party will be informed per email as soon as the target price for the article has been reached, or when the price for the article DECREASES.
You can view statistics for how many people enter target prices and for which articles in the "Statistics" - "Target price" menu.



Activate this function on this page by setting the checkbox,

You can edit the text of the automatically sent email under the "Ordering system > "Email texts".

setup.plugins.wunschpreis.xpl_wunschprei.kurztext: Activation of the target price function
setup.plugins.wunschpreis.xpl_wunschprei.name: Activation of the target price function
setup.plugins.wunschpreis.xpl_wunschprei.text:
If you have activated the "Target price" function,
your customers will be notified per email when you have lowered the prices for the article.

setup.plugins.wunschpreis.xpl_wunschprei.kurztext:
(Email) 
As soon as a customer enters a target price, an email is set to this address. Leave empty if you don't want to be notified of a target price having been entered.
setup.plugins.wunschpreis.xpl_wunschprei.name: Email notification
setup.plugins.wunschpreis.xpl_wunschprei.text: As soon as a customer enters a target price, an email is sent to this address. Leave empty if you don't want to be notified of a target price having been entered.

setup.plugins.wunschzettel.name: Wish list:
setup.plugins.wunschzettel.text:
With the wish list you can allow your customers to create an online wish list in the shop (similar to a wedding registry).

 

Customers place articles on a wish list and send it per email to friends and relatives.

The recipients can now buy the articles in the shop. The person receiving the gift can see on their wish list what has already been bought. This ensures that nothing is bought twice.

setup.plugins.wunschzettel.xpl_wunschzet.kurztext: general mode activation. Information in Help.
setup.plugins.wunschzettel.xpl_wunschzet.name: Mode activation
setup.plugins.wunschzettel.xpl_wunschzet.text:
Description of the wish list function:
As a logged-in customer, here you can create a so-called "present table". Fill your wish list, which will be protected by a password. You can decide who can have access to it and place articles directly from the wish list into the shopping cart. After the purchase, the article will disappear from the wish list. 

A perfect chance for your customers to create a selection of gifts they really want for their birthday, wedding or baby shower.

setup.plugins.wunschzettel.xpl_wunschzet.kurztext: if activated, will be displayed in the side navigation of the block for the wish list info
setup.plugins.wunschzettel.xpl_wunschzet.name: Show wish list box
setup.plugins.wunschzettel.xpl_wunschzet.text: if activated, will be displayed in the side navigation of the block for the wish list info

setup.plugins.officeline_import.xpl_offi.name: E-Mail-Adresse, die im Fehlerfall benachrichtigt werden soll.
alle Artikel neu importieren
setup.plugins.officeline_import.xpl_offi.text: aktivieren Sie diese Setup-Option nur, um einen erneuten einmaligen Vollimport aller Artikeldaten auszulösen. Diese Aktion ist etwa nach einer Anpassung der automatischen Preisanpassung nötig, sonst in der Regel nicht, da Artikel-Änderungen vollautomatisch eingelesen werden.

setup.plugins.officeline_import.xpl_offi.name: alle Media-Daten neu importieren
setup.plugins.officeline_import.xpl_offi.text: aktivieren Sie diese Setup-Option nur, um einen erneuten einmaligen Vollimport aller Mediadaten der Artikel auszulösen. Diese Aktion ist in der Regel nicht notwendig, da Media-Änderungen vollautomatisch eingelesen werden.
